0.title: US-based firm Meta.is to sue Meta for stealing its name
0.article_body: A US-based virtual reality company META.is is suing Meta for allegedly stealing its name and violating the company’s established brand. Meta.is in a post wrote, "Facebook seized our META mark and name, which we put our blood, sweat and tears into building for over 12 years." It added that it had discussed a potential partnership with Facebook in 2017.

1.title: 2nd autopsy conducted in my absence: Kallakurichi student's father to SC
1.article_body: The father of the 17-year-old Class 12 girl student, who allegedly died by suicide in Tamil Nadu's Kallakurichi, claimed that her second autopsy was conducted in his absence. He had moved the SC seeking a particular team of doctors in the panel constituted to do the second post-mortem. The father withdrew his petition seeking a stay on the second autopsy.

2.title: Delhi govt to begin coaching classes for underprivileged class 10, 12 students
2.article_body: Delhi government will begin special classes for class 10 and 12 students from marginalised backgrounds starting next week under the Jai Bhim Mukhyamantri Pratibha Vikas Yojna. Under this programme, the government provides free coaching to talented students of scheduled castes, scheduled tribes and poor families for competitive exams like JEE, medical and civil services.

3.title: Pune police arrest 2 people for cheating 4 BJP MLAs of ₹3,400 each
3.article_body: A Pune police official said on Thursday that two people were arrested for allegedly cheating four BJP MLAs of ₹3,400 each after one of the duo sought the money claiming that his mother was hospitalised. The accused had reportedly required the money for daily needs. The duo was nabbed using a telephonic tracing system, DCP (Zone 5) Namrata Patil said.

4.title: 2nd youngest kid in India with rare disorder gets bariatric surgery in Mumbai
4.article_body: A 20-month old child, Ibrahim Khan, has become the second youngest child in India to undergo bariatric surgery in India. According to reports, he has Leptin receptor (LepR) deficiency. His surgery was performed in Mumbai. His elder sister Zoya, now 12 years old, also has same genetic disorder and was the youngest in the country to undergo bariatric surgery.

5.title: Sri Lankan troops raid main anti-govt protest camp as new Prez takes over
5.article_body: Sri Lankan security forces have raided the main anti-government protest camp in the capital Colombo and cleared out a section of it. The troops armed with batons and assault rifles swooped in on protesters camping at the Presidential Secretariat, saying the protesters have "no legal right to hold it". This comes after Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as President.

6.title: Man jailed for sexually assaulting 5-yr-old girl: Rachakonda Police
6.article_body: Rachakonda Police said on Friday that a sessions court has sentenced a 67-year-old man to three years in jail on charges of sexually assaulting a five-year-old girl in 2015. The police added that Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat and Additional Police Commissioner G Sudheer Babu announced a reward for the IO, CDO and Additional Public Prosecutor for their efforts.

7.title: 2 Indians to feature in men's javelin throw final at World C'ships for 1st time
7.article_body: Neeraj Chopra and Rohit Yadav have qualified for the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships 2022. With this, two Indians will feature in the men's javelin throw final at World Athletics Championships for the first time in history. Chopra qualified with a best throw of 88.39 metres, while Yadav qualified with a best throw of 80.42 metres.

8.title: $80 billion wiped off combined m-cap of companies that sell online ads in a day
8.article_body: About $80 billion was wiped out of the combined market value of companies that sell online ads after Snap reported poor quarterly results. While shares of Alphabet fell 3%, wiping out over $40 billion from its market capitalisation, Meta Platforms dropped 5%, erasing about $25 billion in market value. Snap shares fell 25%, cutting its market value by $7 billion.

9.title: Who cares, do I look 55: Akshay Kumar on working with younger actresses
9.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that those who criticise him for working with younger actresses are "jealous". "I can work with them. Do I look 55? I don't understand the problem. They just get jealous and keep on writing it. Some media person will write and some trolling will happen. Who cares?" he added.

10.title: 35-year-old drunk man kills 60-year-old father in Pune, arrested
10.article_body: A 35-year-old man has been arrested for killing his 60-year-old father in Pune, police said. The accused, who was in an inebriated state, had a heated argument with his father when the murder took place on July 15, police added. The incident came to light after the deceased's brother suspected his nephew as he was missing after the incident.

11.title: If you put us both in a room, you have to hide sharp objects: Samantha on ex-husband
11.article_body: While talking about her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya on Koffee with Karan Season 7, Samantha Ruth Prabhu said, "Like if you put us both in a room, you have to hide sharp objects." Samantha said this when Karan Johar asked if there were any hard feelings between her and Naga. She added that the situation was not amicable right now.

12.title: It's a good motivation to work out: Musk on jokes over his Mykonos shirtless pics
12.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user over jokes about his recent shirtless pictures in Mykonos, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said, "It's good motivation to work out, eat healthier and maybe take my shirt off outside more than once a year." The user had tweeted, "Anyone posting a shirtless pic of Musk...must...post a shirtless picture of themselves for comparison".

13.title: IAS officer shares his Class 10 marksheet, jokes 'It remained classified since 1997'
13.article_body: IAS officer Shahid Choudhary shared a picture of his Class 10 marksheet, revealing he got 339/500 marks. He wrote, "On students' demand...here's my...marksheet which remained 'classified' since 1997." Responding to a comment on his low marks in Mathematics and Social Studies, he wrote, "Friends proved helpful in Mathematics...while I...avenged Social Studies' [marks] by taking Sociology in UPSC."

14.title: 27-yr-old woman killed as her car crashes into metro pillar in Gurugram
14.article_body: A 27-year-old woman was killed after her car allegedly crashed into a metro pillar on Golf Course Road in Gurugram on Wednesday, police said. When her daughter was returning home after meeting her friends, an unknown vehicle being driven rashly hit her daughter's car from the side, the woman's mother claimed. "Her car got imbalanced...rammed into the pillar," she added.

15.title: Who were the top remittance recipients among low and middle income nations in 2021?
15.article_body: As per a WHO report, India was the top remittance recipient in 2021 among low and middle income countries. India received $87 billion in remittance in 2021, the report said. India is followed by China and Mexico ($53 billion each). Meanwhile, Philippines and Egypt received $36 billion and $33 billion in remittance, respectively.

16.title: 3 arrested in Delhi for trafficking tribal women in guise of placement agency
16.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday rescued 10 tribal women, including six minors, from the premises of an illegal placement agency in Mukundpur. Of the four identified as accused in the case, three have been arrested and the prime accused is still absconding. Prime accused had organised the entire syndicate of getting girls from Jharkhand over a period of time, police said.

17.title: Navi Mumbai man injured after ceiling plaster falls on him while sleeping
17.article_body: A 52-year-old man escaped with injuries after plaster from the ceiling of a City and Industrial Development Corporation (CIDCO)-constructed building fell on him in Navi Mumbai. The false ceiling neutralised the plaster's impact to some extent, the man said. Residents said this was the fourth incident of plaster falling since the man has been living in the house since 2003.

18.title: 4 held for alleged robbery, extortion in B'luru; ₹6 lakh recovered
18.article_body: Bengaluru Police have caught four people accused of involvement in extortion and robbery cases at multiple locations in the city. The police also recovered five two-wheeler vehicles and 20 mobile phones, the total of which is said to be around ₹6 lakh. All mobile phones were used for extortion and other illegal activities by the gang, reports said.

19.title: Neeraj Chopra qualifies for World C'ships final with 3rd best throw of his career
19.article_body: Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra has qualified for the men's javelin throw final at the World Athletics Championships 2022 with the third-best throw of his career. The 24-year-old advanced to the final by producing a best throw of 88.39 metres in his first attempt in the qualification round. The final will take place on Sunday (IST).

20.title: Pujara slams 3rd double ton in county this season; Sundar, Saini take five-wicket hauls
20.article_body: Chesteshwar Pujara slammed his third double hundred for Sussex in the ongoing county season. While, Washington Sundar and Navdeep Saini took five-wicket hauls for their county debut for Lancashire and Kent, respectively. Pujara slammed the double ton against Middlesex at Lord's while Sundar and Saini took their five-wicket hauls against Northamptonshire and Warwickshire, respectively.

21.title: 25-km Kanwar yatra to spread gender equality message in U'khand on July 26
21.article_body: A 25-km Kanwar yatra to spread the message of gender equality will be held in Uttarakhand on July 26. The yatra will start at Har Ki Pairi and end with a 'jalabhishek' at Veerbhadra temple in Rishikesh. State Women Empowerment Minister Rekha Arya, yoga guru Baba Ramdev and Panchdashnam Joona Akhada chief patron Harigiri Maharaj will be present there.

22.title: Real fascism: Cong as TV anchor booked for 'criticising' Kerala MP
22.article_body: Leader of Opposition in the Kerala Assembly, VD Satheesan, criticised police for booking Asianet TV news anchor Vinu V John for a comment he allegedly made during a TV discussion in March. John had made some observations regarding Elamaram Kareem, a Rajya Sabha MP from Kerala. Satheesan said booking an anchor for "raising criticism" against an MP is "real fascism".

23.title: 23-yr-old dies by suicide over fall in viewership on YouTube channel
23.article_body: A 23-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Hyderabad on Thursday reportedly due to fall in number of viewers on his YouTube channel, officials said. The deceased was a student of IIITM, Gwalior and was currently attending classes online. Police said he jumped from the third floor of his residential building in the morning and died on the spot.

24.title: Spain, Portugal resist EU calls to cut gas consumption by 15%
24.article_body: Spain and Portugal on Thursday said they would not support the European Commission's proposal to reduce gas consumption by 15% amidst fears that Russia could cut off supplies ahead of winter. Madrid and Lisbon said they use very little Russian gas in comparison to other EU nations and their energy supplies are very different from the rest of Europe.

25.title: UK's Supreme Court to hear Scotland's independence case in October
25.article_body: The UK Supreme Court on Thursday said it will hear arguments on whether Scotland can conduct an independence referendum without the British government's approval in October this year. Pro-independence Scottish leader Nicola Sturgeon said Scotland's plebiscite on secession will be held on October 19, 2023. Outgoing Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s government has denied any such vote now.

26.title: Tantrik allegedly promises to land woman job using witchcraft, rapes her in Raj
26.article_body: A 27-year-old married woman has alleged that a 40-year-old tantrik has been raping her for the past one year in Rajasthan, police said. The woman also claimed that the accused, named Champalal, recorded some obscene videos and blackmailed her. The woman stated that she fell in Champalal's trap after he promised to land her a job using witchcraft, police said.

27.title: Passengers de-boarded after bomb scare on Patna-Delhi IndiGo flight, plane being checked
27.article_body: All 134 passengers were de-boarded at Patna airport after a bomb scare on a Patna-Delhi IndiGo flight on Thursday night. The plane is being checked by bomb disposal squad, said reports. According to reports, a passenger of the flight himself said that he is carrying a bomb in the bag.

28.title: Roof collapse kills four of a family in Punjab's Patiala
28.article_body: A roof collapse of a house killed four members of a family and injured one in Punjab's Patiala, the police said. The collapse of the roof occurred due to heavy rains while the members of the family were sleeping inside the rented accommodation at Jakhal Road in Patran. The injured, identified as 15-year-old Vikas, sustained head injuries, an official said.

29.title: Karnataka to serve eggs in midday meals to tackle malnutrition
29.article_body: The Karnataka government decided to include boiled eggs, bananas and groundnut cakes in midday meals for students from class 1-8 to tackle malnutrition. Education Minister BC Nagesh said that vegetarian students will not be forced to consume eggs. Calling these the best available protein-rich food items, he said that the eggs will be boiled in the school premises.

30.title: Jammu-Srinagar national highway reopens for one-way traffic
30.article_body: The 270 km Jammu-Srinagar national highway reopened for one-way traffic on Thursday, after it was shut down due to landslides owing to heavy rainfall in Ramban district, as per officials. Nearly 1,000 vehicles stranded at different points in the district were allowed to move. Work is underway to clear the highway for two-way traffic, Ramban police added.

31.title: State-wise list of votes polled in Presidential election released
31.article_body: BJP-led NDA's candidate Droupadi Murmu won the Presidential election by securing 64.03% votes. Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha received 35.97% votes. The state-wise list of votes polled in the election shows Yashwant didn't receive a single vote in Andhra Pradesh, Sikkim and Nagaland. President-elect Murmu received 181 votes in Maharashtra and 287 in Uttar Pradesh.

32.title: BJP govt misusing central agencies, democracy is in danger: Gehlot
32.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot slammed the central government for misusing central agencies, like the Enforcement Directorate, and said that democracy is in danger, ahead of Congress interim president Sonia Gandhi's appearance before the agency. "Our fight is to save the nation. Today, if they (BJP) would have been in our place, they would have indulged in arson," said Gehlot.

33.title: China is now top priority for British intelligence: MI6 chief
33.article_body: China is now the top priority for UK's Secret Intelligence Service, MI6 chief Richard Moore said on Thursday. Understanding how China pursues its strategic goals is a particularly complex challenge, he added. "And there's a role for organisations like mine in helping British...policymakers to understand that, so they can navigate this...difficult relationship with the Chinese," he further said.

34.title: Ranveer Singh poses nude for Paper magazine
34.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has posed nude in an article for 'Paper' magazine. Speaking to the magazine, he said, "In some of my performances I've been damn f**king naked...That's being actually naked." "I can be naked in front of a thousand people, I don't give a shit. It's just that they get uncomfortable," Ranveer added.

35.title: Choubey appointed C'garh Panchayat & Rural Development Minister
35.article_body: Chhattisgarh government named Ravindra Choubey as the state's Panchayat and Rural Development Minister on Thursday. The 65-year-old has replaced TS Singh Deo, who resigned from the post on July 16. While resigning, he said he was unable to fulfil the targets of the department. He also claimed that funds weren't sanctioned under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana despite his repeated requests.

36.title: Shining example of women empowerment: Patnaik on Droupadi Murmu
36.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik congratulated Droupadi Murmu on Thursday for her victory in the Presidential elections. "Her journey from a humble beginning to become the First Citizen of the country is...inspiring...Her journey is a shining example of women empowerment," the CM tweeted. "[I] congratulate the daughter of Odisha," he added. President-elect Murmu was born in a tribal family in Odisha.

37.title: Truth will prevail over 'arrogance & dictatorship': Rahul Gandhi
37.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at the Central government on Thursday over its unwillingness to discuss issues like inflation and misuse of agencies, asserting that "the truth will prevail over dictatorship". His attack came on the day Congress president Sonia Gandhi appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in the National Herald money laundering case.

38.title: Heatwaves predicted to return to China over next 10 days
38.article_body: Heatwaves are forecast to return to China over the next 10 days with temperatures expected to rise across the country, meteorologists warned on Thursday. This comes days after 86 cities in the country, including Shanghai, issued red alerts amid soaring temperatures. Notably, heatwaves and wildfires are being reported across several parts of the world, including the United Kingdom and Spain.

39.title: Ship spills 35,000 gallons of fuel off island in Bahamas
39.article_body: A ship spilled around 35,000 gallons of fuel into the ocean off an island in The Bahamas on Wednesday. The crew of the ship had deployed absorbent pads and containment buoys, according to a statement from Bahamas-based Sun Oil. Notably, the island of Great Exuma is famed for its white sand beaches and crystal-blue waters.

40.title: Opium worth ₹10 crore seized in Guwahati
40.article_body: Police seized opium worth ₹10 crore and arrested four persons in connection with it in Assam's Guwahati on Thursday. Officials said the 20503 Dibrugarh-New Delhi Rajdhani Express train was raided based on a tip-off. "The weight of opium is 10.11 kg and market value is approximately ₹10 crore. They were carrying the opium from Dimapur to Howrah," an official said.

41.title: US publishes list of suspected corrupt actors in Central America
41.article_body: The US State Department has released a list of 60 current and former officials suspected of corruption in Central American nations Honduras, El Salvador, Guatemala and Nicaragua. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said these individuals contribute to irregular migration and destabilising societies. The US visas of those mentioned in the list are generally revoked.

42.title: Italy's Prez dissolves Parliament after PM Draghi's resignation
42.article_body: Italy's President Sergio Mattarella dissolved the country's Parliament on Thursday, clearing the way for an early election. "The dissolution of the parliamentary chamber is always the last choice," Mattarella said. Notably, the development comes after Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi's resignation earlier today following the collapse of his national unity government.

43.title: Turkey denies conducting airstrikes in northern Iraq
43.article_body: Turkey on Thursday dismissed reports that its military carried out airstrikes in northern Iraq on Wednesday, killing eight tourists. Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlut Cavusoglu said Ankara was ready to cooperate with Baghdad to ascertain who carried out the "treacherous attack" in the Kurdish-run district of Zakho. Cavusoglu said Turkey's fight in Iraq is with only the Kurdistan Workers Party.

44.title: President-elect Murmu greets Union ministers outside Delhi home
44.article_body: President-elect Droupadi Murmu on Thursday greeted Union ministers, political leaders and media present outside her residence in Delhi. Union ministers Dharmendra Pradhan and Kiren Rijiju were among those who met her. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi and BJP chief JP Nadda visited Murmu's residence to congratulate her on being elected as the 15th President of India.

45.title: 'Namaste Vietnam' festival to mark 75 yrs of Indian Independence
45.article_body: The first-ever 'Namaste Vietnam' fest will be held in Ho Chi Minh City and Nha Trang from August 12-21 to mark 75 years of India's independence. The 10-day festival has been planned in accordance with India's 'Act East policy' and will also mark 50 years of diplomatic ties between the countries, official release stated. Several celebrities will attend the festival.

46.title: Iran recalls envoy to Sweden in protest over ex-official's jail sentence
46.article_body: Iran has recalled its ambassador to Sweden in protest against a jail sentence handed by Swedish court to an ex-Iranian prison official. The court said that Hamid Noury, who was sentenced to life in jail, had participated in "executions of many political prisoners" in the 1980s. However, Iran said that the verdict "is based on baseless, distorted and fabricated accusations".

47.title: Golden moment for India: BJP chief congratulates President-elect Murmu
47.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda on Thursday congratulated Droupadi Murmu on being elected as the 15th President of the country. He said this is a golden moment for India. "Murmu's elevation to the highest office of the country today shows that the BJP government is determined for the welfare of every section," Nadda said.

48.title: NCLT orders insolvency proceedings against Future Retail
48.article_body: The Mumbai bench of National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) on Wednesday allowed a consortium of lenders, led by Bank of India (BoI), to initiate insolvency proceedings against debt-laden Future Retail. The tribunal also rejected e-commerce major Amazon's objection to BoI's petition. Amazon had alleged that the petition to initiate insolvency proceedings against the Indian retailer was "malicious".

49.title: Historic moment as Prez's post will be held by tribal woman: Meghalaya CM
49.article_body: After Droupadi Murmu was elected as the President of India, Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma said, "It's a great and historic moment as the President's post will now be held by a tribal woman." "It's something that was inconceivable many years ago. I'd like to thank all who voted for our President, PM and others...who made this possible," he said.

50.title: Al Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri is alive, lives in Afghanistan: UN
50.article_body: Al Qaeda chief Ayman al-Zawahiri is alive and resides in Afghanistan where he communicates openly, a recent report by the UN has claimed. The report further stated that ties between the Taliban and Al Qaeda are still strong. Separately, the report noted that the Islamic State (IS) is using Afghanistan as a platform for its global expansion.

51.title: 5 Kanwariyas saved from drowning while bathing in Ganga in U'khand
51.article_body: Five Kanwariyas were saved from drowning while bathing in the Ganga in Uttarakhand's Haridwar on Thursday, an official said. The strong currents of the river swept them away, the official added. Jawans of the 40th battalion of the Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) deployed on the banks of the river saved the Kanwariyas, who were residents of Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad.

52.title: Shah congratulates Murmu, says 'she fought against odd circumstances'
52.article_body:
Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday congratulated Droupadi Murmu on being elected the President of India. He said, "[She] has reached this highest position of the country today after fighting against the odd circumstances...it shows the immense power of our democracy."
Murmu, belonging to Odisha's tribal community, was elected as India's 15th President.

53.title: How many recruitments were made by UPSC, SSC and IBPS in the last 2 years?
53.article_body: The government on Thursday stated in Rajya Sabha that during the last two years amid COVID-19 pandemic, the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC), Staff Selection Commission (SSC) and Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) recruited 1,59,615 people. As per the data shared by the government, the UPSC recruited 8,913 people, SSC recruited 97,914 people and IBPS recruited 52,788 people.

54.title: Arjun Kapoor sells Mumbai flat bought for ₹20 crore at ₹16 crore: Report
54.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor sold his apartment in 81 Aureate building in Bandra West for ₹16 crore, as per reports. The 4,364-square-foot flat is on the 19th floor of the building. Arjun reportedly purchased the property last year for ₹20 crore. Arjun's sister, Anshula, signed the sale papers and the stamp duty paid for the registration was ₹96 lakh, reports added.

55.title: K'taka to bring policy to ensure power supply to every household: CM
55.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said the state government has decided to bring a policy to ensure power supply to every poor household in the state. Addressing a crowd at the 53rd Formation Day of Karnataka Power Corporation, Bommai said, "Electricity is one of the essential services...It's the duty of the government to provide electricity just like supply of drinking water."

56.title: Indonesian pilot dies after landing passenger plane amid health issue
56.article_body: The pilot of a passenger airplane in Indonesia suffered a health emergency after take-off on Thursday and was forced to return to the airport before being rushed to a hospital where he later died. However, the cause of the pilot's death wasn't immediately known. Citilink Indonesia said that all crew were declared fit in health checks prior to the flight.

57.title: Many nations are trying to run cricket like football: PCB chief Ramiz Raja
57.article_body: PCB Chairman Ramiz Raja said many nations are trying to run cricket like football. "They'll realise what they've done when they complete the calendar. They will realise that if your captain isn't strong, your team can't progress," he added. Ramiz further said, "I haven't interfered in the team selections, even though I can do it. It is my right."

58.title: WestBridge Capital raises $1.5 bn to invest in Indian firms: Report
58.article_body: Investment fund WestBridge Capital has raised $1.5 billion to invest in Indian companies, as per reports. WestBridge Capital has backed unicorns such as LEAD and Vedantu, and this is its largest-ever fund for India-focused companies. WestBridge Capital's total portfolio includes as many as 132 companies, and its assets under management in India have reportedly crossed $10 billion.

59.title: SC halts hearing in Gyanvapi mosque case till Varanasi court verdict
59.article_body: Supreme Court has decided to halt the hearing of appeal filed by Gyanvapi mosque's management committee till Varanasi court announces its verdict on the committee's plea questioning the maintainability of the suit filed by Hindu plaintiffs. It adjourned the hearing to October. It also refused to entertain petitions seeking the right to worship the alleged 'Shivling' found at the site.

60.title: Hang killers of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal: LS member
60.article_body: Speaking in the Parliament, Lok Sabha member Arjun Lal Meena called for the hanging of the killers of Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal. He said capital punishment would prove to be a deterrent for those who plan to destabilise peace in Udaipur. He also called for a ban on activities of Dawat-e-Islami, a Pakistan-based organisation allegedly linked to the incident.

61.title: Fast food chain Burger Singh raises ₹30 cr in Series A round
61.article_body: Homegrown fast food chain Burger Singh has raised ₹30 crore in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Negen Capital and saw participation from LetsVenture, Mumbai Angels, Old World Hospitality and singer Jasleen Royal, along with existing investors. The company aims to use the funds to launch 120 food court outlets in the current fiscal.

62.title: Ex-RJD MLA Anant Singh sentenced to 10 yrs in jail in another arms case
62.article_body: Former RJD MLA Anant Singh was on Thursday sentenced to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment in another case relating to recovery of arms and explosives from his residence. He was awarded the same quantum of sentence by the court in June in a 2019 case relating to the recovery of an AK-47 rifle, ammunition and grenades from his Mokama residence.

63.title: Unmarried woman cannot be denied choice to abort: Supreme Court
63.article_body: The Supreme Court passed an interim order allowing an unmarried woman to terminate her 24-week pregnancy, provided her life is not endangered. Justice DY Chandrachud noted that the 2021 amendment in Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act used the term 'partner' instead of husband. Parliamentary intent is not to confine the benefits to situations arising out of marriages, the bench observed.

64.title: UP ministers to hold road shows in over 20 countries ahead of investors' meet
64.article_body: Uttar Pradesh ministers will be going on foreign tours to showcase the state as an 'investment hub' ahead of the Global Investor Summit, 2023 in the state. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has set a target of ₹10 lakh crore in investments in the summit. The event will have one day dedicated to the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises sector.

65.title: Gutkha worth ₹17.50 lakh seized from 2 Navi Mumbai houses, one held
65.article_body: Gutkha, pan masala and tobacco products worth ₹17.50 lakh were seized after raids were conducted at two houses in Navi Mumbai's Kopar Khairane and Ghansoli. Police said they arrested 37-year-old Manoj Kumar Narendra Khanda, who stocked the banned products. During the raid, 32 sacks of pan masala, 15 sacks of tobacco and 11 sacks of scented pan masala were found.

66.title: Edtech platform Creative Galileo raises $7.5 mn in Series A round
66.article_body: Early learning edtech platform Creative Galileo has raised $7.5 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Kalaari Capital, Affirma Capital, East Ventures, Valiant Employee Investment Fund, and angel investors. Founded in July 2020 by Prerna A Jhunjhunwala and Nikhil Naik, the startup claims to have over 7 million downloads. It has 7,00,000 monthly active users.

67.title: 151 grams of gold worth ₹7.82 lakh seized at Jaipur airport
67.article_body: The Customs officials seized 151 grams of gold worth ₹7.82 lakh from a passenger who arrived at Jaipur International Airport from Dubai, an official said on Thursday. "The smuggled gold of 99.50 purity...has been seized under the provisions of the Customs Act, 1962," the official said. A gold bangle and a ring were found concealed in clothes, the official added.

68.title: US-based Biliti Electric unveils hydrogen fuel cell-powered 3-wheeler
68.article_body: E-mobility company Biliti Electric has unveiled what it claims to be the world's first hydrogen fuel cell-powered electric three-wheeler vehicle. Biliti claimed the vehicle, named FastMile, has a refueling time of less than three minutes and offers a range of up to 209 kilometres. FastMile has a payload capacity of 680 kilograms and has been tested for over 9,656 kilometres.

69.title: UP minister Dinesh Khatik meets CM after resigning, says 'will continue in office'
69.article_body: A day after resigning as the Uttar Pradesh Minister of State for Jal Shakti, Dinesh Khatik on Thursday met CM Yogi Adityanath and said he'll continue in the post. "Whatever my issues were, I've put them before the CM. Action will be taken," he said. Khatik had alleged that he was being ignored by officials as he is a Dalit.

70.title: Ukrainian First Lady appeals for more weapons to US lawmakers
70.article_body: Ukraine's First Lady Olena Zelenska has addressed US lawmakers, appealing for more western weapons, particularly air defence systems, in its war against Russia. The request came as Russia indicated plans to take broader areas in eastern Ukraine. Till date, the US and NATO have sent HIMARS rocket launchers, heavy artillery, armor, drones, air defence systems and warplanes to Ukraine.

71.title: 4 killed as under-construction building's wall falls in Bengaluru
71.article_body: Four persons were killed and four others sustained injuries when the wall of an under-construction building fell on them in Bengaluru on early Thursday morning. The deceased were identified as construction labourers from Bihar, who were sleeping at their worksite on Soukya Road in Hosakote area at the time of the accident. The injured were rushed to a nearby hospital.

72.title: Minister plays drums after Droupadi Murmu becomes President of India
72.article_body: Union Minister Meenakashi Lekhi played drums after NDA candidate Droupadi Murmu became the President of India on Thursday. Murmu has become India's first tribal woman President. She won against Opposition nominee Yashwant Sinha by a huge margin. PM Narendra Modi congratulated Murmu and said, "Her record victory augurs well for our democracy."

73.title: US Prez Biden unveils measures to tackle climate change
73.article_body: US President Joe Biden has unveiled a set of executive measures to tackle climate change, calling it "literally an existential threat to our nation". The move comes as parts of the US experience extremely high temperatures. According to the measures, states will be provided $2.3 billion to "increase resilience to heat waves, drought, wildfires, flood, hurricanes, and other hazards".

74.title: Govt to introduce new Emigration Bill for safe & legal migrations
74.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs will introduce a new Emigration Bill to promote "safe and legal" migration and prevent illegal recruitment agencies from cheating people, the Centre told Rajya Sabha on Thursday. "[The] new...bill...will take into account a lot of digital tracking," EAM S Jaishankar said. Centre is also working with state governments to spread awareness on safe emigration.

75.title: PM Modi visits Droupadi Murmu's residence to congratulate her on becoming President
75.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Droupadi Murmu's residence to congratulate her on being elected as the 15th President of India. A video has been shared online showing PM Modi greeting her with a bouquet. BJP National President JP Nadda was also present. Droupadi Murmu is the second woman to be elected as India's President.

76.title: KL Rahul tests positive for COVID-19 ahead of India-West Indies series
76.article_body: India batter KL Rahul has tested positive for COVID-19, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said. Rahul was included in India's squad for the T20I series against West Indies subject to fitness. Rahul last played an international match in February this year. He hasn't played professional cricket since IPL 2022 due to a groin injury. He had undergone groin operation in June.

77.title: India scripts history: PM as he congratulates Droupadi Murmu on being elected President
77.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while congratulating Droupadi Murmu on being elected President of India, tweeted, "India scripts history." "A daughter of India hailing from a tribal community born in a remote part of eastern India has been elected our President!" he added. "Her record victory augurs well for our democracy," the PM wrote.

78.title: 15,000 Russians troops killed fighting in Ukraine, says CIA chief
78.article_body: CIA chief William Burns on Wednesday said the US estimates that around 15,000 Russian troops have been killed and 45,000 others have been injured in the war in Ukraine. "The Ukrainians have suffered as well - probably a little less than that. But, you know, significant casualties," he added. Currently, Russian forces occupy around a fifth of the country.

79.title: Facebook's main feed to be revamped to prioritise content discovery: Meta
79.article_body: Meta on Thursday said it was revamping Facebook's main feed to prioritise "discovery" of new content, instead of posts and accounts users follow. 'Home', Facebook's main news feed tab, will start heavily featuring popular posts from accounts that users don't follow, including reels and stories. Facebook is investing in artificial intelligence to serve recommended content, Meta said.

80.title: We will continue to stand by the people of Sri Lanka: MEA
80.article_body: Amid the severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka, a spokesperson for the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Thursday said, "We will continue to stand by the people of Sri Lanka." The comment came a day after the Sri Lankan Parliament elected Ranil Wickremesinghe as the country's President. India has provided aid, including medicines and fuel supplies, to Sri Lanka.

81.title: Man hides $13,000 inside his turban, caught at Kolkata airport
81.article_body: Customs officials at Kolkata airport on Tuesday arrested three people and recovered $42,000 from them. One of them was carrying $13,000 by hiding currency notes in the folds of his turban. Around $29,000 were kept on the outer side of two different bags by removing the stitching and sewing it back with the money inside.

82.title: Yashwant Sinha pens note after losing Presidential election, quotes Bhagavad Gita
82.article_body: Yashwant Sinha tweeted a note after losing Presidential election to Droupadi Murmu. "I accepted...offer of Opposition parties solely guided by...philosophy of Karma Yoga preached by Lord Krishna in...Bhagavad Gita- 'Do your duty without expectation of fruits thereof'," he wrote. He congratulated Murmu, saying, "India hopes...she functions as...Custodian of the Constitution without fear or favour."

83.title: US President Joe Biden tests positive for COVID-19
83.article_body: US President Joe Biden has tested positive for COVID-19, the White House said on Thursday. The White House added that he is "fully vaccinated and twice boosted and experiencing very mild symptoms". He will isolate at the White House and "will continue to carry out all of his duties fully during that time," the press release stated.

84.title: Govt spent ₹911 crore on advertisements over last 3 yrs: Thakur
84.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday informed the Rajya Sabha that the Centre had spent ₹911.17 crore on advertisements in newspapers, television channels and web portals in the past three years. Advertisements on newspapers accounted for over ₹690 crore of the total amount, according to Thakur. TV advertisements cost the government nearly 200 crore, Thakur said.

85.title: 'Death pool' that kills anything that swims into it discovered at the bottom of Red Sea
85.article_body: Scientists from University of Miami have discovered a long brine pool at the bottom of Red Sea that's lethal to most creatures. Rare brine pools in Red Sea are extremely salty. They cannot sustain marine life forms because they are devoid of oxygen. The scientists made the discovery at a depth of 1,770 metre using a remotely operated underwater vehicle.

86.title: Air India Dubai-Cochin flight diverted to Mumbai after 'low pressure' in cabin
86.article_body: A Dubai-Cochin Air India flight was diverted to Mumbai after an incident of low pressure was reported in the cabin, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) said. The flight landed safely in Mumbai, the DGCA added. "Two senior officers of O/o DAS WR have been assigned the task to carry out a preliminary investigation," the DGCA further stated.

87.title: Droupadi Murmu set to become President of India as she crosses halfway mark
87.article_body: Droupadi Murmu is set to become the 15th President of India after crossing the 50% mark of total valid votes at the end of third round of counting. Hailing from Odisha's Mayurbhanj, she has served as the Governor of Jharkhand from 2015 to 2021. She's contesting against Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha. Voting for the post took place on July 18.

88.title: Russia's war on Ukraine making China rethink on Taiwan: CIA chief
88.article_body: China is basing Russian military offensive in Ukraine to determine when and how, and not whether, to invade Taiwan, CIA chief Bill Burns has said. Burns added that China is "unsettled" when looking at Russia-Ukraine war, calling it "strategic failure" for Russian President Vladimir Putin. Notably, China has warned US of consequences if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan.

89.title: Kejriwal ignores LG's advice, says 'will go ahead' with Singapore visit
89.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wrote a letter to Delhi LG VK Saxena, saying he'll "go ahead" and attend World Cities Summit in Singapore. Earlier, Saxena advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit, saying prima facie it's meant for Mayors. "Then the Prime Minister wouldn't be able to go anywhere...[In] most of his visits, he...discusses subjects [outside his jurisdiction]," Kejriwal said.

90.title: Last rites of Haryana DSP killed amid mining raid performed in Hisar
90.article_body: The last rites of Haryana DSP Surender Singh, who was run over by a truck during a mining raid in Nuh, were performed with full state honours at his native village in Hisar on Thursday. Deputy Speaker Ranbir Gangwa, Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi and DGP PK Agrawal were present there. He is survived by his wife and two children.

91.title: Parts of ₹14,850-crore Bundelkhand Expressway cave in within 5 days of inauguration
91.article_body: Pictures have surfaced online showing parts of Bundelkhand Expressway caving in. Prime Minister Narendra Modi had inaugurated the expressway in Uttar Pradesh on July 16. The expressway has been constructed at a cost of ₹14,850 crore. The expressway passes through seven districts of Uttar Pradesh, namely Chitrakoot, Banda, Mahoba, Hamirpur, Jalaun, Auraiya and Etawah.

92.title: Govt’s aim is 'character assassination': Pilot on Sonia's ED questioning
92.article_body: Criticising the Centre over Congress chief Sonia Gandhi's questioning by the ED, party leader Sachin Pilot on Thursday said that the BJP government's sole aim is to indulge in the "character assassination" of people. "This questioning has been initiated to damage the morale of the leadership, target the Opposition and trample upon the voice of the Opposition," he said.

93.title: No COVID-19 restrictions during Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi, Muharram: Maha CM
93.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said all COVID-related restrictions during Ganesh Chaturthi, Dahi Handi and Muharram have been lifted in the state. There are no restrictions on the height of Ganesh's idols, Shinde said. "Our festival should be celebrated without any problems...A single window permission system will be there. All the concession will be given," he added.

94.title: European Central Bank raises interest rates for first time in 11 years
94.article_body: The European Central Bank (ECB) on Thursday raised interest rates for the first time in more than 11 years. The ECB raised its key interest rate by 0.5 percentage points to 0.0%. The ECB said that the increase is necessary to limit the pressure on prices over the next two years. It also increased its main refinancing rate to 0.50%.

95.title: Man stabs, pushes brother off 4th floor over property dispute in B'luru
95.article_body: A 37-year-old man allegedly killed his younger brother by stabbing him and pushing him from the fourth floor of a building over a property dispute in Bengaluru. According to reports, an argument broke out between the two brothers when the accused proposed the sale of one of two buildings owned by their father to clear loans.

96.title: Demanding patch-up with wife, drunk man climbs mobile tower in Maha
96.article_body: A man, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, climbed atop a 100-foot mobile phone tower in Maharashtra, seeking his wife's return from her parent's place, a police official said on Thursday. The man came down only after an assurance from villagers, fire brigade and police personnel that they would strive to solve the domestic dispute, he added.

97.title: Summit is for Mayors: Delhi LG as he denies CM's plea for Singapore visit
97.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has refused to approve CM Arvind Kejriwal's proposal regarding visiting Singapore to attend the World Cities Summit. The LG advised Kejriwal to not attend the summit since it is a conference of Mayors and won't be befitting for a CM to attend it, ANI reported. The summit is set to commence on July 31.

98.title: Solar panels costing ₹88 cr to be installed on ORR cycling track in Hyd
98.article_body: Solar panels along the 21-km cycling track on outer ring road (ORR) will be installed by Hyderabad Growth Corridor Limited (HGCL), a wing of Hyderabad Metropolitan Development Authority (HMDA), at a cost of ₹88.12 crore. "The solar panels...would generate about 7 MV to 9 MV power per year," an official said. The HGCL has reportedly invited tenders for the project.

99.title: Bengaluru records highest daily rainfall in July in 14 years
99.article_body: After recording the wettest June in 10 years, Bengaluru has seen the highest daily rainfall in July in 14 years after recording 82.6 mm of rainfall on July 20, IMD data said. According to the Karnataka State Natural Disaster Monitoring Centre, Sampangi Rama Nagar received the highest rainfall of 79.5 mm in 24 hours till 8:30 am on Thursday.

100.title: 2 dozen cars damaged during attack in housing society in Gurugram
100.article_body: Around 15 men damaged over two dozen cars at a housing society in Gurugram's Sector 70A, the police said on Wednesday. The assailants also assaulted the housing society's security guards, the police added. Sources have said that the attack is a result of a personal enmity with a resident of the society.

101.title: Pune RTO commences drive against illegal bike taxi services
101.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office on Monday commenced drive against illegally operating app-based auto rickshaw services and bike taxis. "We are strictly checking the auto-rickshaws and two-wheelers which are running without authorised meters and with the mobile app-based system," RTO official Ajit Shinde said. "Earlier, we had seized more than 250 illegal bikes. The same will be done now," he added.

102.title: If Sonia doesn't call off protests, we won't consider her Indian: Uma
102.article_body: Reacting to protests over Enforcement Directorate's summons to Congress' Sonia Gandhi in National Herald case, BJP's Uma Bharti said it'll be determined if Gandhi's an Indian citizen if she stops the protests. "Otherwise we won't...forget that she's of Italian origin and doesn't respect Indian law," Bharti tweeted. Seventy-five Congress MPs were detained today for protesting over Gandhi's summons.

103.title: HC refuses to entertain PIL seeking clean milk for Delhi citizens
103.article_body: The Delhi HC on Thursday refused to entertain a PIL to "advise" the Lieutenant Governor of Delhi and the Commissioner of city police to ensure a supply of clean and hygienic milk. In the petition, the petitioner said that the "neglected, abandoned and pathetic condition of the cattle" is affecting the health of Delhi citizens.

104.title: Trinamool Congress to abstain from voting in Vice Presidential election
104.article_body: The Trinamool Congress headed by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee will abstain from voting in the upcoming Vice Presidential poll, party MP Abhishek Banerjee said on Thursday. He said the party will not support NDA candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar, who was the Governor of West Bengal. The Opposition has fielded Margaret Alva in the election.

105.title: No additional amount to be charged for issuing boarding passes at airport counters
105.article_body: Ministry of Civil Aviation on Thursday said it has come to its notice that airlines are charging additional amount for issuing boarding passes from the passengers seeking check-in at airport counters. "Airlines are advised not to charge any additional amount...as the same cannot be considered within the 'tariff' as provided under Rule 135 of the Aircraft Rules, 1937," it said.

106.title: Female users in India leaving Facebook over privacy fear: Meta study
106.article_body: Female Facebook users in India are leaving the platform over concerns about their safety and privacy, said a study conducted by Facebook-parent Meta which was reviewed by Reuters. "Concerns about content safety and unwanted contact impede women's Facebook use," the study added. Other obstacles faced by Facebook include nudity content, perceived complexity of its app design and literacy barriers.

107.title: Break BJP's prison, bring people's government in 2024: WB CM Mamata
107.article_body: While addressing a rally in Kolkata, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Thursday urged the people to break BJP's prison and elect a people's government in the 2024 elections. "What will the people eat when the BJP is implementing GST on everything, even puffed rice and milk powder. How will the poor survive in this country?" she said.

108.title: OYO marketing chief Rohit Kapoor likely to join Swiggy: Report
108.article_body: Hotel aggregation platform OYO's Global Chief Marketing Officer, Rohit Kapoor, has reportedly quit and will join Swiggy as its first Chief Executive Officer of food delivery business, according to reports. Rohit Kapoor took on his current role in April 2022, after Ankit Gupta was elevated as CEO of Softbank-backed OYO. He will report to Swiggy founder and CEO Sriharsha Majety.

109.title: 94 YouTube channels, 19 social media accounts blocked in 2021-22: Govt
109.article_body: Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said that in 2021-22, the government blocked 94 YouTube channels, 19 social media accounts and 747 URLs engaged in anti-India activities. Government has taken strict measures to stop people from creating propaganda, Thakur said. "The government also issues advisory...to the media to adhere to the laid down Codes," he added.

110.title: Nykaa, Estee Lauder launch beauty incubator with ₹4-crore pool
110.article_body: Beauty and personal care retailer Nykaa has launched an incubator programme, Beauty&You India, in partnership with American beauty brand Estee Lauder with a prize pool of ₹4 crore. The new incubator programme allows beauty companies to showcase their brand and have an opportunity for acquisition. Apart from the prize money, the winners will also get mentorship from industry experts.

111.title: 7 get jail term for harassing women during Bonalu festival in Hyd
111.article_body: A local court on Wednesday sentenced seven persons to undergo jail term for harassing women during Bonalu festivities, Hyderabad Police tweeted. The accused were taking photographs of women visiting the temple on the occasion of the festival and were caught red-handed by the She Teams, police stated. The accused were sentenced to prison ranging from two days to ten days.

112.title: ODI cricket is dying, I think it should be scrapped: Wasim Akram
112.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram has said that ODI cricket is dying, adding that administrators should consider scrapping the 50-over format. Akram added, "It's quite tiring for a player to play one-day cricket. After T20, one-day cricket seems it is going for days. So players are focussing on more shorter format. And longer format obviously [with] Test cricket."

113.title: 2 killed as their vehicle rams into container truck in UP's Basti
113.article_body:
Two people were killed when the vehicle they were travelling in rammed into a container truck after it was hit by another truck from behind in Uttar Pradesh's Basti, police said on Thursday.
The deceased have been identified as 45-year-old Manjay Yadav and 35-year-old Raju. The accident affected the movement of traffic on the highway for sometime, police added.

114.title: Droupadi Murmu leads by 812 votes after 2nd round of counting in Presidential poll
114.article_body: BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu is leading by a margin of 812 votes after the second round of counting in the Presidential poll. Murmu has received 1,349 votes so far, valued at 4,83,299, Rajya Sabha Secretary General PC Mody said. Meanwhile, Opposition's candidate Yashwant Sinha has got 537 votes, valued at 1,89,876, he added.

115.title: 300 units of free electricity in Gujarat if AAP wins: Kejriwal
115.article_body: In the run up to Gujarat Assembly elections, Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal has promised free electricity up to 300 units per month if elected. Speaking at a town hall meeting in Surat, Kejriwal said AAP will waive off pending power bills till December 31, 2021. This will be implemented within three months of being elected, he said.

116.title: Samajwadi Party intimidates Muslims for votes: SBSP chief
116.article_body: Suheldev Bhartiya Samaj Party (SBSP) chief Om Prakash Rajbhar on Thursday criticised his alliance partner Samajwadi Party over its treatment of Muslims. "The Samajwadi Party (SP) gets votes of Muslims by intimidating them but when the time comes to give the Muslim community their rights, the party turns its back on them," Om Prakash Rajbhar said.

117.title: UK Queen's jewels on show at Buckingham Palace to mark 70-yr reign
117.article_body: Personal jewels of UK's Queen Elizabeth II will be put on display at Buckingham Palace from Friday for Platinum Jubilee celebrations. Tiaras, earrings and necklaces form part of "The Queen’s Accession" exhibition, which marks her seven decades on the throne. Queen Elizabeth II is the second-longest reigning monarch in the world after France's Louis XIV who reigned for 72 years.

118.title: Mahindra shares edited pic of footwear outside UK PM's residence as Sunak enters top 2
118.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share an edited viral picture of footwear outside UK PM's residence, 10 Downing Street. "Brit-Indian humour has gone into overdrive with Shri [Rishi] Sunak in the final shortlist of two [in UK PM race]. Of course the real test lies ahead with the larger mass of party faithful," he wrote.

119.title: Woman gives birth on road in UP after accident, dies minutes later
119.article_body: A woman gave birth to her child on a road minutes before her death because of a road accident in UP, police said on Thursday. The deceased, along with her husband, was travelling on their motorcycle when a truck rammed into the two-wheeler near Bartara village, ASP (city) Mukesh Chandra Mishra said.

120.title: Good job: Moosewala's father after gangsters killed in police encounter
120.article_body: Singer Sidhu Moosewala's father, Balkaur Singh, visited Amritsar hospital to identify the two gangsters who were killed in an encounter with Punjab Police on Wednesday. Gangsters Jagroop Singh Roopa and Manpreet Singh were involved in Moosewala's murder. "It's a good job done by Punjab Police and such actions should continue...This is just a start," Balkaur said after identifying their bodies.

121.title: Bengaluru civic body to file FIRs against illegal banners
121.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike will lodge an FIR by the end of this week against persons installing illegal banners. Speaking on hundreds of political banners installed recently, BBMP chief Tushar Giri Nath said, "We have warned...several times...FIR will be lodged against the violators." As per a High Court order, no banners can be put up in BBMP limits.

122.title: Everything’s fine with Putin: Kremlin rejects rumours on his health
122.article_body: The Kremlin on Thursday said that "everything is fine" with Russian President Vladimir Putin's health. "Ukrainian information specialists and American and British ones have been throwing out various fakes [rumours] about the state of the President's health," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. A video showing Putin limping as he arrived in Iran on Tuesday has surfaced on social media.

123.title: Control room set up to facilitate Kanwar Yatra in GB Nagar: Police
123.article_body: A special control room has been set up to facilitate movement of Kanwariyas through the Gautam Buddha Nagar district, police officials said on Wednesday. The control centre has been set up at the Chilla border in Noida, they added. Separately, movement of heavy vehicles has also been restricted on the routes used by Kanwariyas, a senior police official said.

124.title: Congress workers burn car near B'luru ED office during protest
124.article_body: Congress workers protesting against Enforcement Directorate (ED) summons to party chief Sonia Gandhi on Thursday burnt a car near the agency's Bengaluru office. Congress workers are protesting across the country against ED questioning Sonia in the National Herald case. She left the ED office in Delhi after being questioned for nearly two hours on Thursday.

125.title: 2 men arrested for stealing bikes & selling them online in Kalyan
125.article_body: Thane Police has arrested two men for motor vehicle theft. The accused, Mohammed Shaikh and Abubakar Shaikh, used to search for bikes on OLX, ask the seller for documents and details and then steal a similar bike. They then created fake documents based on documents taken from the seller, change the stolen bike's number plate and sell it online.

126.title: Woman who accused Rajasthan minister's son of rape moves Delhi HC
126.article_body: A woman who accused Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi's son of raping her multiple times moved Delhi HC on Thursday seeking cancellation of anticipatory bail granted to the man by trial court. The woman in her petition stated that the accused, Rohit, has been threatening her to withdraw her complaint since being out on bail. She filed the complaint in May.

127.title: 2 Kanwar Yatris killed, 3 injured in accident on Delhi-Haridwar highway
127.article_body: Two Kanwar Yatris died and three were injured in a head-on collision between two scooters on the Delhi-Haridwar highway in Uttarakhand on Wednesday night, police said. Due to the impact of the collision, the victims were flung into the air and landed several feet away, an official said. The deceased have been identified as Rahul and Shyam Thakur.

128.title: World 100m champion Kerley out of world 4x100m relay with injury
128.article_body: Newly-crowned 100m champion Fred Kerley has been ruled out of the US team for the 4x100m relay at the World Championships in Oregon with a "slight injury to his quadriceps". Kerley suffered the injury in the 200m semi-finals, finishing sixth in 20.68 seconds. Kerley had said he cramped up in the later stages of the 200m.

129.title: Bihar electrician dies while fixing transformer as someone switches on power
129.article_body: An electrician, who had climbed a transformer to repair a technical glitch, was reportedly burnt alive at a village in Bihar's Nalanda district after someone switched on the power supply. "The technician went on the transformer after he cross-checked with the power supply station," a villager said. "It looks like someone deliberately switched on the power supply," he added.

130.title: Naomi Osaka parts ways with coach Wim Fissette
130.article_body: Former world number one Naomi Osaka has parted ways with her coach Wim Fissette. Osaka won two of her four Grand Slam titles, the US Open in 2020 and the Australian Open in 2021, under Fissette's guidance. "It has been a privilege to coach Naomi since 2019 and see her grow into the champion she has become," said Fissette.

131.title: Azam is Pak's captain cool, should lead us until retirement: Miandad
131.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Javed Miandad said Babar Azam is Pakistan's "captain cool", adding that he should lead the national team until he retires from cricket. "[He is] our number one captain...He leads from the front," stated Miandad. "The most important thing is he is performing brilliantly himself," he said. Former India captain MS Dhoni is known as 'captain cool'.

132.title: Myanmar's economy remains fragile amid civil strife: World Bank
132.article_body: Myanmar's economy remains fragile amid civil strife in the country, the World Bank and other experts said on Thursday. "Inequality is estimated to have worsened, with those already poor falling into deeper destitution," the World Bank claimed. Myanmar is one of several countries in Asia whose economies are imperilled by soaring prices and weaker currencies, according to a report.

133.title: Aamir hosts Gujarati dinner for 'Avengers: Endgame' directors Russo brothers, pic viral
133.article_body: Aamir Khan hosted a Gujarati dinner for Anthony and Joe Russo, the directors of 'Avengers: Endgame', who are in India for the promotional tour of 'The Gray Man'. They were also joined by the film's actor Dhanush and Aamir's ex-wife Kiran Rao. Aamir reportedly also flew down chefs specialising in Gujarati delicacies for the dinner.

134.title: I will never sing with him: Priyanka Chopra on husband Nick Jonas
134.article_body: Actress-singer Priyanka Chopra said she will "never sing" with husband and singer Nick Jonas. "I don't have the audacity to collaborate with him...Whenever I sing in the car, like when my jam is on...then he'll just look at me like that, I just get quiet," Priyanka had earlier stated. Priyanka and Nick got married in 2018.

135.title: Matter of pride for tribals if she becomes next Prez: Murmu's brother
135.article_body: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu's brother Tarinisen Tudu on Thursday said that it will be a matter of pride for the tribal community, Odisha and the country if she becomes the next President of India. The counting of votes began on Thursday, with Murmu bagging 540 votes after the first round. Opposition candidate Yashwant Sinha managed 208 votes.

136.title: Karti Chidambaram writes to Serious Fraud Investigation Office to review Byju's finances
136.article_body: Congress MP Karti Chidambaram has written to Serious Fraud Investigation Office to investigate finances of Byju's. Chidambaram stated Byju's violated law by missing the legal deadline to file the Cost Audit Report for FY 2020-21. "Byju's proposes to...acquire Nasdaq-listed company 2U for $2.4 billion, while parallelly firing employees...it becomes pertinent to review [its] finances," he wrote.

137.title: Govt releases pic of 1st stamp of independent India
137.article_body: The government on Thursday released a picture of the first stamp of independent India. "The 1st Stamp of Independent India was issued on November 21, 1947 and was valued at three & a half annas," it tweeted with the picture. The picture was released under 'Moments With Tiranga' campaign.

138.title: Big question mark: Kartik on rumours about his cameo in Ranbir's film
138.article_body: Reacting to the rumours that he will be making a cameo in Luv Ranjan's upcoming film, actor Kartik Aaryan has said, "It's a big question mark." The film features actor Ranbir Kapoor and actress Shraddha Kapoor. Speaking about Luv, Kartik said, "He has been my lucky charm. Our journey has been great. I can't say much about the film."

139.title: Autonomous vehicle with detachable steering wheel unveiled by China's Baidu
139.article_body: China's search engine giant Baidu on Thursday unveiled its new autonomous vehicle (AV) with a detachable steering wheel, with plans to put it to use for its robotaxi service in China next year. The new AV won't need human intervention and will have eight lidars and 12 cameras alongside it. The AV's price will also drop to about 2,50,000 yuan.

140.title: Shiv Sena leader backing Uddhav Thackeray attacked in Maha, 2 held
140.article_body: Police on Thursday arrested two people in connection with the attack on a worker of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena in Maharashtra, an official said. Harshawardhan Palande, Deputy Chief of the Sena's Kalyan city unit, was attacked by four to five men with sticks and rods on Wednesday, a police official said.

141.title: BJP is blinded by their desire for revenge: Baghel on Sonia's ED questioning
141.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED on Thursday, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said the BJP is "blinded by their desire for revenge". "This is the same woman who was married to [former] PM Rajiv Gandhi," Baghel added. "Sonia Gandhi has not been well, of late, and yet the BJP is after her," he stated.

142.title: School bus with 21 kids catches fire in Delhi, no casualties; video surfaces
142.article_body: A bus carrying 21 children from the Bal Bharti Public School caught fire in the middle of a road in Delhi's Rohini on Thursday. No one was injured in the incident due to quick action by the driver, police said. A video shows flames engulfing the bus, rising several feet above it. Three cars near the bus were also burnt.

143.title: Former beauty queen arrested for stealing wine worth $1.5 million in Spain
143.article_body: A 28-year-old former beauty queen from Mexico has been arrested for stealing wine from a Spanish restaurant. Priscila Lara Guevara, along with a Romanian-Dutch man, stole 45 vintage bottles worth $1.5 million, The Telegraph said in its report quoting the Spanish media. Guevara and the man were caught this week crossing into Croatia from Montenegro.

144.title: Told Disha 'You need to take yourself more seriously' after Malang: Mohit
144.article_body: Talking about Disha Patani, filmmaker Mohit Suri said, "When I watched the climax of 'Malang' with the audience, I...messaged her...'You need to take yourself more seriously. You're not just a pretty face'." He added very few people take it as a compliment and she understood what he was trying to say. "She should...take herself...seriously as an actor," he concluded.

145.title: Doors of Matoshree open for those who want to return: Aaditya to Shinde camp
145.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Aaditya Thackeray on Thursday said that real Shiv Sainiks are still with the party led by Uddhav Thackeray. Referring to MLAs who joined Eknath Shinde-led government, he added that the doors of Matoshree are going to remain open for those who want to return. The ones we trusted and offered ministerial posts, backstabbed us, he further said.

146.title: Wrong to summon 2 members of same family again & again: Cong leader
146.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED in connection with the National Herald case on Thursday, party leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said it is wrong to summon two members of the same family over and over again, that too in connection with the same case. The agency earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case.

147.title: It's duragrah not satyagrah: BJP MP Prasad on Congress' protests
147.article_body: Commenting on the protests held by Congress over Sonia Gandhi's appearance before the Enforcement Directorate (ED), BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "This is not satyagrah but duragrah against the country, its laws and its agencies." "This is also a duragrah for protecting the family which has pocketed the party's assets worth thousands of crores of rupees," the MP added.

148.title: 26-yr-old man stealing bikes on pretext of trial rides held in Mumbai
148.article_body: A 26-year-old man from Hyderabad, Zubair Irfan Sayyed, was arrested in Mumbai for stealing multiple luxury bikes from people across the city on the pretext of trial rides. "In May, Sayyed absconded with a Charkop resident's Trump bike," a police official said. Two expensive bikes, which are worth about ₹15 lakh, were also recovered from the accused, police added.

149.title: 42-year-old man arrested for cheating woman of ₹2.30 lakh in Thane
149.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Sagar Raut, was arrested from Thane for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹2.30 lakh after befriending her on Facebook, police said on Wednesday. Gaining the woman's confidence, Raut asked her to invest money in a financial scheme. After taking ₹2.30 lakh, he allegedly assured her that he will pay her ₹20,000 per month as return on investment.

150.title: 3 more die in Assam from Japanese Encephalitis, death toll reaches 35
150.article_body: At least three more persons were killed in Assam in the last 24 hours from Japanese Encephalitis, taking the death toll so far to 35, according to the National Health Mission (NHM), Assam. A total of 24 new cases were reported during the period. As many as 226 cases of Japanese Encephalitis have been detected in July so far.

151.title: TMC will win seats outside WB in 2024 LS polls: Abhishek Banerjee
151.article_body: TMC National General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee on Thursday asserted that the party will continue with its expansion plans and will win seats outside West Bengal in 2024 Lok Sabha elections. He further said that tickets for next year's panchayat elections will be distributed on the basis of "merit and not recommendations". Banerjee was addressing workers at the Martyrs' Day rally.

152.title: BJP will be defeated in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: WB CM Mamata Banerjee
152.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday said the BJP will be "swept away from power" at the Centre in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. Terming BJP government as "anti-people", Banerjee said, "BJP will not get a single-party majority, and once that happens, others will unite to form the next government." "They will be defeated," she added.

153.title: 3 Indians carrying pistols held by Pak authorities at Wagah border
153.article_body: Pakistani authorities have arrested three Indians who were returning from Pakistan via the Wagah-Attari border after they were found carrying pistols with them. The persons, who belong to the same family and hail from UP's Shamli district, were detained by Pakistani customs on Wednesday. They were on a visit to Pakistan to attend a family function there, officials said.

154.title: 5 killed due to lightning in Bihar, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
154.article_body: Five people were killed after being struck by lightning in Bihar. CM Nitish Kumar on Wednesday expressed condolences over the deaths and announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh to the family members of each of the deceased. "Stay at home in bad weather," the CM tweeted. The deaths were reported in the districts of Siwan, Samastipur, Gaya, Khagaria and Saran.

155.title: Salaries of top Hollywood stars released; Tom Cruise earns most with $100 million
155.article_body: Tom Cruise has become Hollywood's highest earning actor, after he earned more than $100 million for 'Top Gun: Maverick', as per Variety. Will Smith came second with $35 million for his upcoming film 'Emancipation', followed by Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt, at $30 million each, for 'Killers of the Flower Moon' and an upcoming untitled Formula 1 drama, respectively.

156.title: Lightning kills 14 in a day in UP, CM Yogi announces ₹4 lakh assistance
156.article_body: Lightning-related incidents killed 14 persons and injured 16 others on Wednesday in Uttar Pradesh. CM Yogi Adityanath has announced financial assistance of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the deceased. As many as four deaths were reported from Banda, two from Fatehpur and one each from Balrampur, Chandauli, Bulandshahr, Raebareli, Amethi, Kaushambi, Sultanpur and Chitrakoot districts.

157.title: The anxiety is beyond comparison: Ranbir Kapoor on becoming a father
157.article_body: Discussing the arrival of his first child following his recent marriage to actress Alia Bhatt, actor Ranbir Kapoor said, "The nervousness and...anxiety for such a thing doesn't compare to anything." "It's beyond [comparison]," added Ranbir. Recently when asked to share two truths and a lie, Ranbir had mentioned having twins along with taking a long break from acting.

158.title: Ruturaj should make his ODI debut vs WI, open with Dhawan: Jaffer
158.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Ruturaj Gaikwad should make his ODI debut against West Indies. "Ruturaj should open with Shikhar Dhawan. He scored four tons in five innings in the Vijay Hazare Trophy and deserves a look in. Also, left-right combo stays," tweeted Jaffer. The 25-year-old has played nine T20Is so far, scoring a total of 135 runs.

159.title: Uddhav not a face for 2024 Lok Sabha polls: Rebel Shiv Sena MP Shewale
159.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray was not a "winnable" face for the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and it was imperative for Shiv Sena to tie up with the BJP, said rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale on Thursday. "I told (Sanjay Raut) that we respect Thackeray but we have to be realistic. He cannot be the face for Lok Sabha polls," Shewale added.

160.title: Don't relate to fragile entertainment of Johars, Chopras: Screwvala
160.article_body: Discussing the films he makes, producer Ronnie Screwvala said he likes to tell stories that can make a difference. Screwvala added he doesn't relate to the "fragile entertainment" of the Johars and the Chopras. However, he stated it doesn't mean their entertainment isn't good. "They pack in all the stars...the songs...people want that kind of entertainment too," he concluded.

161.title: 'Revadi' is called 'prasad' when distributed to public for free: Kejriwal
161.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal responded to BJP's "revadi culture" remark and said, "When 'revadi' is distributed among public for free, then it's called 'prasad'." "But when [revadi] is given for free to your own friends, ministers, then it is 'paap' (sin)," he added. His statement comes after BJP said that "revadi culture" may push Gujarat towards Sri Lanka-like crisis.

162.title: Cyberabad Police arrest 35-yr-old man for cheating, marrying 13 women
162.article_body: The Cyberabad Police have arrested a 35-year-old man for allegedly cheating and marrying 13 women across Andhra Pradesh and Telangana in last four years. The accused, hailing from Andhra Pradesh's Guntur district, used to target rich women who were divorced and looking for alliances, reports said. After marrying them, the accused absconded with their money and valuables, reports added.

163.title: 21-yr-old engineering student found dead in hostel room in B'luru
163.article_body: A 21-year-old engineering student was found dead in her hostel room in Bengaluru's Kengeri area on Wednesday, police said. The deceased, identified as Shivani K, was a native of Bidar. The incident came to light when the warden went to check on Shivani after she missed her exam. Police have registered a case of unnatural death and are investigating.

164.title: Over 1.5 lakh people left Sri Lanka since Jan amid economic crisis
164.article_body: Over 1.5 lakh people have left Sri Lanka since January of this year to pursue job prospects abroad, Sri Lankan foreign employment bureau informed. The top destinations where Sri Lankan expatriates migrated to this year include Kuwait, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, South Korea and Japan, the bureau said. Sri Lanka is reeling under its worst economic crisis in over seven decades.

165.title: What are the salaries of Hollywood stars as Tom Cruise tops list with $100 million?
165.article_body: Tom Cruise has become Hollywood's highest earning actor, after he earned more than $100 million for 'Top Gun: Maverick', as per Variety. Will Smith came second with $35 million for his upcoming film 'Emancipation', followed by Leonardo DiCaprio and Brad Pitt, at $30 million each, for 'Killers of the Flower Moon' and an upcoming untitled Formula 1 drama, respectively.

166.title: World's most powerful telescope discovers oldest galaxy ever seen, pic surfaces
166.article_body: The world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, has discovered the oldest galaxy ever seen. The galaxy is known as GLASS-z13 and it existed 13.5 billion years ago. The GLASS-z13 galaxy was spotted in the 'early release' data from the James Webb Space Telescope's main infrared imager, called NIRcam.

167.title: BJP leader shares Maha Cong chief's video with woman, he reacts
167.article_body: BJP leader Chitra Wagh tweeted a video purportedly showing Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole with a woman. "I'm not peeping into anyone's personal life. The video has already gone viral," she told reporters. Calling it a "character assassination" attempt by the BJP, Patole said he has asked his legal team to examine the video and take appropriate action against Wagh.

168.title: If Gandhi family is spotless, why is it anxious?: Anurag Thakur
168.article_body: As Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi appeared before ED, Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Thursday said that it’s the duty of probe agencies to investigate people involved in corruption. "If the Gandhi family is spotless, why is it anxious? If they have not indulged in corruption then why this ruckus," Thakur added.

169.title: Military believes it's not a good idea for Pelosi to visit Taiwan: Biden
169.article_body: US President Joe Biden said the military officials believe that it's "not a good idea" for US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi to visit Taiwan at this moment. Biden's comments came a day after China's Foreign Ministry said it would take "strong measures" if Pelosi visited Taiwan. The Financial Times had reported that Pelosi would visit the Chinese-claimed island next month.

170.title: Not even 10% nullahs cleaned: BJP on waterlogging in Mumbai
170.article_body: BJP MLA Yogesh Sagar on Wednesday alleged that the waterlogging in Mumbai following heavy rains is due to lack of nullah cleaning. "Despite spending crores of rupees...not even 10% of nullah cleaning has taken place this year before the monsoon," Sagar said. "Strict action should be taken against the contractors and I urge...BMC Commissioner to stop their payments," he added.

171.title: No need for female James Bond: 'No Time to Die' actress Ana De Armas
171.article_body: Actress Ana De Armas, who had featured in the James Bond film 'No Time to Die', has said that there is no need for female James Bond. "There shouldn't be any need to steal someone else's character...to take over," she stated. However, Ana added actresses in the upcoming James Bond films should be given a more substantial part and recognition.

172.title: ED questions Sonia Gandhi for 2 hours, ends session at her request
172.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi left the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Delhi after being questioned for nearly two hours in the National Herald case. The agency ended the question session at her request as she is recovering from COVID-19, officials said. Her questioning was postponed earlier as she was hospitalised after testing positive for the infection.

173.title: Series against India opportunity to beat the best cricketers in world: Powell
173.article_body: West Indies batter Rovman Powell has said the series against India is an opportunity to defeat the "most favoured and fancy team" in cricket. "It provides an opportunity...to stake a claim and make a name against the best cricketers of the world," he added. Powell further said that he wants to test himself against Yuzvendra Chahal in the series.

174.title: ED should've questioned Sonia Gandhi at her residence: Yashwant Sinha
