174.article_body: Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said Enforcement Directorate (ED) should've gone to Congress leader Sonia Gandhi's residence to question her in the National Herald case. He also accused ED of humiliating political leaders. "We condemn this and resolve to continue and intensify our collective fight against...policies of Modi Sarkar," a joint statement by Opposition parties read.

175.title: MP man attacked with sharp weapons for supporting Nupur Sharma
175.article_body: A man was injured after he was attacked by a group of people armed with sharp-edged weapons, in Madhya Pradesh, for allegedly expressing support for suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma on Wednesday, officials said. Following a complaint, the police filed a case against 13 people for the attack on the man and arrested two of the accused, the police said.

176.title: Delhi court adjourns Sharjeel Imam's interim bail hearing till July 23
176.article_body: A Delhi court on Wednesday adjourned the interim bail hearing of activist and former JNU scholar Sharjeel Imam till July 23. "Imam did not make any conscious call for violence or incitement to violent activities," his advocate told the court. Imam was allegedly assaulted and called a "terrorist and anti-national" during a security check inside Tihar jail on June 30.

177.title: Sri Lanka made dumb bets on Chinese investments, says CIA chief
177.article_body: CIA chief Bill Burns has said that Sri Lanka's "dumb bets" on Chinese investment are one of the factors for the country's economic crisis. "The Chinese have a lot of weight to throw around and they can make a very appealing case for their investments," Burns claimed. Sri Lanka's example should serve as a warning to other nations, Burns added.

178.title: Sadhu sets himself on fire to protest against illegal mining in Raj
178.article_body: A sadhu set himself on fire on Wednesday to protest against illegal stone mining in Bharatpur, Rajasthan. The sadhu, Vijay Das, was rescued by policemen and was rushed to a hospital. Earlier, another sadhu scaled a mobile tower to protest. Sadhus are protesting against mining in hills of Adi Badri and Kankachal, which are revered by devotees of Lord Krishna.

179.title: Over 500 disabled people cheated via scam in Pune; police seize ₹1 cr
179.article_body: Pune Police have busted a fraudulent investment scheme that cheated 570 people with hearing and speech impairments and have so far seized ₹1 crore from the accused. The six accused, all of whom have been arrested, are also hearing and speech impaired. The accused had reportedly promised the investors of double returns on their money within two months.

180.title: I am not a friend of Rajapaksas: Sri Lanka's new Prez Wickremesinghe
180.article_body: Sri Lanka's new President Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that he's "not a friend of the Rajapaksas" but "a friend of the people". Wickremesinghe added he would give people the change they want. In recent months, the three brothers from the Rajapaksa family, Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa, PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, were forced to resign amid mass protests.

181.title: Droupadi Murmu leading with 540 votes in Presidential poll after 1st round of counting
181.article_body: NDA's Droupadi Murmu is leading with 540 votes in Presidential election after the 1st round of counting, PC Mody, Secretary General, Rajya Sabha, said. He added that Opposition's Yashwant Sinha has secured 208 votes with a value of 1,45,600. Results of the Presidential election are expected around 4 pm.

182.title: Somebody has to be looking to score a hundred vs India: WI coach Simmons
182.article_body: West Indies coach Phil Simmons has said their priority is to bat out the entire 50 overs in the ODIs against India. "Somebody has to be looking to score a hundred and hold the team together," stated Simmons. "India are a stronger bowling team but we expect a better batting performance," he added. The first ODI will be played tomorrow.

183.title: Rupee's depreciation against US$ lower than other key currencies: CEA
183.article_body: Indian Rupee's depreciation against the US$ has been lower than that of other major global currencies, said Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran. "You look at the Japanese Yen and the British Pound. They all have depreciated much more against the US$," Nageswaran said. "RBI is managing the monetary policy and has announced liberalised rules to attract inflows," he added.

184.title: Maharashtra govt lifts stay on constructing Aarey car shed
184.article_body: The Maharashtra government has lifted the stay on constructing a car shed in Mumbai's Aarey Milk Colony for Metro 3. Former Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray had put the stay on assuming office in November 2019. Several environmental groups had opposed the decision to set up the car shed in the wooded Aarey area.

185.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann admitted to hospital after drinking polluted water: Report
185.article_body: Days after he drank a glassful of water directly from Kali Bein, a holy rivulet in Sultanpur Lodhi, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was reportedly admitted to Delhi's Apollo Hospital with stomach ache on Tuesday. A video shows him drinking the water, which contains sewage waste. On Sunday, he visited Sultanpur Lodhi to mark 22nd anniversary of cleaning of Kali Bein.

186.title: Other sides will dance if Suryakumar isn't in lineup for WI ODIs: Styris
186.article_body: Ex-New Zealand all-rounder Scott Styris said every other team around the world will dance if batter Suryakumar Yadav is not included in India's lineup for the ODIs against West Indies. "He's got...match-winning potential...No pressure situations get to him," added Styris. Suryakumar recently scored 117 off 55 balls in the third T20I against England. He had a strike rate of 212.72.

187.title: I've seen sister Khushi work hard & tirelessly for 'The Archies': Janhvi
187.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor opened up about her sister Khushi Kapoor's debut film 'The Archies'.  "I've seen my sister work tirelessly...work really hard and she's auditioning for this role," she stated. Janhvi added, "She wanted this so badly, I'm just so happy for her and I hope it goes well." The film also features Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan.

188.title: Goa will host the 37th National Games in 2023: Sports Minister
188.article_body: Sports Minister Govind Gaude informed that Goa will host the 37th National Games in 2023. "I am very much happy to announce that...the government of Goa has received an email from Indian Olympics Association in consultation with the Union Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports that Goa will be the host city for organising 37th National Games,” Gaude said.

189.title: BCCI spends ₹3.5 crore on Team India's chartered flight to West Indies from UK: Reports
189.article_body: The BCCI spent around ₹3.5 crore on booking a chartered flight for India to reach West Indies from United Kingdom, reports said. "The reason a chartered flight was booked for the team was not COVID-19. It's difficult to book so many tickets in a commercial flight," a BCCI source said. "It was a logical option to take," the source added.

190.title: GST imposed on puffed rice, curd, what will people eat?: Mamata in Kolkata
190.article_body: Addressing a rally on TMC's Martyrs' Day in West Bengal's Kolkata, CM Mamata Banerjee criticised BJP for the current rise in GST rates and said, "Now that GST has been imposed on puffed rice as well, so will the people of BJP not eat that now." "GST is levied on sweets, lassi, and curd. What will people eat?" she added.

191.title: So hard-hitting & engaging: Karan Johar on Alia Bhatt's 'Darlings'
191.article_body: Taking to Instagram, Karan Johar praised Alia Bhatt's upcoming film 'Darlings'. "So fun! So hard-hitting and so engaging! All at once...Congratulations my baby girl Alia, what a brave decision to begin your producer journey with," he captioned the post. Karan praised Shah Rukh Khan and his wife Gauri Khan for giving a "green light" to the project.

192.title: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi resigns
192.article_body: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi has handed in his resignation to President Sergio Mattarella, who asked him to remain in office in a caretaker capacity. The President's office did not say whether Mattarella would dissolve parliament or call early elections. Draghi's resignation came after three coalition parties withdrew their support for his government.

193.title: ED should have gone to Sonia Gandhi's house for investigation: Raj CM Gehlot
193.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot has criticised the Enforcement Directorate for asking Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi to appear in its Delhi office for questioning in connection with the National Herald case. "The kind of personality and aura she has and since she is more than 70 years old, ED should have gone to her house for investigation," Gehlot said.

194.title: Goa tourism body demands rollback of GST hike on small, medium hotels
194.article_body: The Travel and Tourism Association of Goa (TTAG) demanded a rollback on hike in GST rate for small and medium hotels, saying it will make them uncompetitive and lead to increase in compliance costs. After the implementation of the new GST rates, hotels with tariffs below ₹1,000 per night will now have to pay 12% GST which was 0% earlier.

195.title: I'm only actor to do 4-5 sex comedies, I'm not ashamed: Riteish Deshmukh
195.article_body: Actor Riteish Deshmukh, who has featured in films like 'Masti', 'Grand Masti', 'Kyaa Kool Hai Hum', has said he is the "only actor" to do "four to five sex comedies". "I'm not ashamed of that...I never thought, what would my son think in the future," he added. He stated he did those films when his father was Maharashtra's Chief Minister.

196.title: Unvaccinated Djokovic to miss US Open after organisers confirm travel policy
196.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic is set to miss the 2022 US Open after the organisers confirmed that they will follow the government's rules on non-citizens being fully vaccinated against coronavirus in order to enter the country. Meanwhile, Djokovic recently made it clear that he would not take the vaccine just to compete in tournaments.

197.title: Microsoft Teams back up for most users after hours-long global outage
197.article_body: Microsoft Teams is back up for most users after an hours-long global outage, the firm said. Over 4,800 reports on issues surfaced in the US and over 18,200 complaints were reported in Japan, as per Downdetector.com. Microsoft had cited a "recent deployment that contained a broken connection to an internal storage service" as the reason behind the outage.

198.title: PM, Shah will have to take many births to understand Gandhi family: Khera
198.article_body: Congress leader Pawan Khera on Thursday said PM Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah will have to "take many births to understand what Gandhi family and Congress party are". His statement came ahead of Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi's questioning by ED. "We'll not hold back, we're not among those who sit at home in fear," Khera added.

199.title: Asked every 'The...' crew member 'How do the Russos know me?': Dhanush
199.article_body: Discussing his film 'The Gray Man' which has been directed by Anthony and Joe Russo, who have also directed 'Avengers: Endgame', actor Dhanush said, "I was very surprised they knew about me." "Whenever I had a conversation with [anyone from the team]...I'd be like...'How do the Russos know about me?'" added Dhanush. "It went on [and] on," he stated.

200.title: I strongly condemn ED's attitude to humiliate political leaders: Sinha
200.article_body: Ahead of Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning, Opposition’s Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha said he strongly condemns the attitude of ED to "humiliate political leaders". "The officers of ED should've gone to her residence even if they had questions to ask [from] Sonia Gandhi," Sinha tweeted. Congress had announced that it will hold a nationwide protest on July 21.

201.title: US President Biden says 'I have cancer'; White House clarifies
201.article_body: While talking about oil refinery emissions on Wednesday, US President Joe Biden said, "That's why I, and so damn many other people I grew up with, have cancer." Biden's Deputy Press Secretary Andrew Bates pointed to his 2021 health exam which noted his treatment for "several, localised non-melanoma skin cancers", which he had removed before he took office.

202.title: When PM Modi was questioned, did we protest?: Prasad on Congress’ protests
202.article_body: BJP’s Ravi Shankar Prasad reacted to Congress’ protests ahead of Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning on Thursday. “When PM Modi was Gujarat CM, he faced questioning…Did we protest? [PM] Modiji appeared before agencies,” Prasad added. Sonia Gandhi has been summoned by ED in connection with the National Herald case.

203.title: Being taken to unknown place: Tharoor after senior Congress leaders detained amid protest
203.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has released a video statement from Delhi Police Bus after senior Congress leaders, including Sachin Pilot, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, were detained amid protests against ED's summon to Sonia Gandhi. "We are being taken by the police to an unknown destination. Two other police buses full of MPs and other party colleagues are there," he said.

204.title: Is Sonia a super human being?: Pralhad Joshi on Congress' protest
204.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi reacted to Congress MPs' protest against questioning of Sonia Gandhi by the Enforcement Directorate and said, "Everybody is equal before the law or not?" "Is the Congress President a super human being? [Congress] thinks they are above the law", he said in Lok Sabha. The House was adjourned till 11:30 am due to the protest.

205.title: Sachin Pilot, Tharoor detained amid Congress protests over ED's questioning of Sonia
205.article_body: Amid protests by Congress, senior leaders including Sachin Pilot, Shashi Tharoor, Ashok Gehlot, Pawan Khera, Harish Rawat and others were detained by police. "We're being taken by police to an unknown destination. Two other police buses full of MPs are there," Tharoor tweeted. Congress workers are protesting against ED's questioning of Sonia Gandhi in connection with the National Herald case.

206.title: Which countries provide visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to Indians?
206.article_body: India has ranked 87th on the list of world's most powerful passports released by Henley Passport Index. The nations providing visa-free access include Fiji, Qatar, Mauritius, Jamaica, Bhutan, Nepal, Indonesia, Oman, Serbia and El Salvador among others. Countries including Thailand, Sri Lanka, Maldives, Iran, Seychelles, Myanmar, Cambodia and Zimbabwe among others provide visa-on-arrival access.

207.title: Grew up watching SRK's films: Anirudh on composing music for 'Jawan'
207.article_body: Composer-singer Anirudh Ravichander, speaking about composing music for Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Jawan', has said that he never had a "specific dream" about making his debut in Bollywood. "I grew up watching Shah Rukh sir's films and I am a big fan...it's going to be a great experience for all of us," he further added.

208.title: Shreyas among first names in India's side if he succeeds vs short balls: Styris
208.article_body: Ex-New Zealand cricketer Scott Styris has said Shreyas Iyer will be among the first names in India's squad if he can resolve his issues against the short balls. "It's now up to Shreyas to find a way to succeed against that style of bowling," he added. Shreyas was dismissed off short deliveries three times during the multi-format series against England.

209.title: Academic institutions need to discharge duties towards society: CM Yogi
209.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said academic institutions shouldn't just become places for distributing degrees, but should also discharge their responsibilities towards society. During a review meeting held on the implementation of National Education Policy (NEP) in the state, the CM called on universities to promote interdisciplinary research work on local problems which are socially relevant.

210.title: Who is Liz Truss, Rishi Sunak's opponent in UK PM race?
210.article_body: Liz Truss, Indian-origin Rishi Sunak's opponent in UK PM race, is currently serving as UK Foreign Secretary. Truss studied philosophy, politics and economics at Merton College, Oxford. Outside politics, she worked in the energy and telecommunications industry for 10 years as a commercial manager and economics director, and is a qualified management accountant.

211.title: Putin seen limping amid concerns over his health; video surfaces
211.article_body: Amid concerns over his health, a video showing Russian President Vladimir Putin limping as he arrived in Iran has surfaced on social media. Videos from recent interviews and public appearances have also shown him holding onto tables and chairs for support and looking bloated. Several reports have claimed that he is fighting Parkinson's disease, while others said he has cancer.

212.title: Spent more time with Naseeruddin than Javed, never became friends: Shabana
212.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi said she would spend more time with actor Naseeruddin Shah than with her husband and lyricist Javed Akhtar at one point, as they did many films together. "We never became friends...He had great regard for my mother Shaukat Kaifi," added Shabana. Naseeruddin had earlier termed 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag' starring Shabana's stepson Farhan Akhtar as "completely fake".

213.title: Mosquito larvae found at several govt offices in Delhi; 76 notices issued
213.article_body: Mosquito larvae were found breeding on the premises of several government offices in Delhi during a drive by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) to check the spread of dengue and other vector-borne diseases. Seventy-six legal notices have been sent to multiple authorities, civic officials informed on Wednesday. Delhi has reported nearly 160 dengue cases so far this year.

214.title: Ex-Sri Lankan Prez Rajapaksa granted short-term visit pass: Singapore
214.article_body: Former Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was granted a 14-day short-term visit pass (STVP) as he entered Singapore on a "private visit" on July 14, Singapore's immigration authorities said. Rajapaksa had fled Sri Lanka along with his wife on July 13 amid mass protests over his alleged mismanagement of the country's economy. He resigned as President after arriving in Singapore.

215.title: Congress workers raise slogans ahead of Sonia Gandhi's ED appearance
215.article_body: Congress leaders and workers on Thursday raised slogans in support of party chief Sonia Gandhi ahead of her appearance before Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the National Herald case. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra accompanied Sonia to the ED office due to her mother's ill health, as per reports. Congress had earlier announced that it would hold a nationwide protest on July 21.

216.title: 13 Opposition parties issue statement over Centre's 'political vendetta'
216.article_body: As many as 13 Opposition parties attended a meeting on Thursday, chaired by the Congress, to discuss the Centre's "relentless political vendetta" through misuse of investigative agencies to target political opponents. This comes ahead of Sonia Gandhi's appearance before ED in Delhi in a money laundering case. "We will intensify our fight against the anti-people Modi sarkar," the Opposition said.

217.title: Pune University introduces computerised paper checking system
217.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) will be using a computerised method to check the students' answer sheets starting this semester. Accordingly, dedicated computers and automatic machines that check the answer sheets within a few seconds are being set up at the university campus. SPPU is presently conducting semester examinations in traditional, offline mode after a gap of two years.

218.title: Sonia Gandhi appears before ED in National Herald case
218.article_body: Congress' interim President Sonia Gandhi has reached the Enforcement Directorate (ED) office to appear for questioning in connection with the National Herald case. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra accompanied her mother to the office due to the leader's ill health, according to reports. The agency earlier questioned Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in connection with the case.

219.title: Thane residents to get 50 MLD additional water from August 1
219.article_body: Maharashtra's water resources department has given nod to supply 50 MLD of additional water to the residents of Thane city from August 1. The decision comes after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde directed the state water resources department to supply additional water to Thane city. The city of Thane is supplied with 485 million millilitres of water per day.

220.title: Manoj Bajpayee refutes reports of playing a police officer in 'Pushpa 2'
220.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has refuted the reports that suggested the actor will be playing a police officer in Allu Arjun-starrer 'Pushpa: The Rise' sequel. Sharing a news report on Twitter, Manoj wrote, "Kahan kahan se samachar laate hai aap log (From where do you guys get such news?)?" The 2021 film was directed by Sukumar.

221.title: Seen such a wonderful knock after a long time: Akram on Shafique's 160*
221.article_body: Reacting to Pakistan opener Abdullah Shafique's 160* which helped his team record the highest successful run chase in Tests, during the first Test against Sri Lanka, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram tweeted, "Take a bow !" "We've seen such a wonderful knock after a long time...[It was] under tremendous pressure...One of the best from a Pakistani I've ever seen," added Akram.

222.title: Kohli made team play without fear, it'll get better with Pant: Arun Lal
222.article_body: Ex-India batter Arun Lal has credited Virat Kohli for "changing Team India's mindset" and making them play "without the fear of losing". "There was a time when winning in Test cricket was considered once you secured a draw," stated Lal. "Virat brought that aggression to the team and it [will] get better if Pant continues [his form]," he added.

223.title: Goa govt firm on introducing app-based taxi services: State minister
223.article_body: The Goa government is firm on introducing app-based taxi services in the state, Goa Transport Minister Mauvin Godinho said. The private taxi operators were opposing the government’s decision every time, Godinho added. "This is a tourist state and this time we can’t allow Goa to get a bad name due to the conduct of these taxi operators," he stated.

224.title: Counting of votes for the Presidential poll 2022 begins
224.article_body: The counting of votes for the 2022 Presidential election began in the Parliament House on Thursday morning. The ballot boxes from all the states have reportedly arrived at the Parliament House and the counting is taking place in room number 63. The voting for the poll took place on Monday where MPs and MLAs across the country cast their votes.

225.title: This pic should teach us humility: Anand Mahindra on photo of Earth taken from Mars
225.article_body: Reacting to a photo of Earth taken from Mars, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "If there's just one thing this photo should teach us...it's humility." The photo, taken by NASA's Curiosity rover, was first shared by the space agency in 2014. NASA had said Earth can be seen "shining brighter than any star in the Martian night sky".

226.title: Gas supply to Europe through biggest pipeline between Russia and Germany resumes
226.article_body: Russian gas has resumed flowing through the biggest pipeline between Russia and Germany. The Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline reopened on Thursday, after being closed for annual maintenance work for 10 days, according to the pipeline operator. Earlier, Russian President Vladimir Putin warned that supplies sent via the pipeline to Europe could be reduced further and might even stop.

227.title: Inmate attacked over watching television in Delhi's Tihar Jail
227.article_body: An inmate was allegedly attacked by two others in a scuffle over watching television at Tihar jail in Delhi, officials said on Wednesday. The fight reportedly broke out in a barrack where offenders aged between 18-21 years are lodged. According to jail officials, the assailants used a sharp metallic piece taken from the fan to attack their fellow prisoner.

228.title: More optimistic I'll win Croatia Open than Djokovic playing US Open: Coach
228.article_body: Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic said he is "more optimistic" of winning the Croatia Open than Djokovic being able to compete at the US Open. "A tough and...sad year, it started with a catastrophe in Australia," added Ivanisevic. The United States doesn't permit entry to unvaccinated travellers. "I'm not vaccinated and I'm not planning to get vaccinated," Djokovic had said.

229.title: Mumbai transport firm cheats adhesive brand of ₹11.57 cr, owner booked
229.article_body: Mumbai Police lodged an FIR against a goods transport firm's owner for allegedly cheating adhesive brand, Pidilite Industries Limited of ₹11.57 crore. The firm gave the brand 1,544 fake invoices and received the payment. "A former senior executive of the brand received 50% share in the illegally obtained profit...this ill-gotten money was transferred to his bank accounts," the complainant claimed.

230.title: Tesla sells 75% of its Bitcoin holdings
230.article_body: Tesla, which revealed a major investment in Bitcoin, has now sold off most of its holdings of the cryptocurrency. The electric carmaker said it had offloaded 75% of its Bitcoin, adding that it bought traditional currency with the $936 million from its Bitcoin sales. Tesla's $1.5 billion investment in Bitcoin prompted a surge in demand for the currency.

231.title: World's oldest known male panda 'An An' dies aged 35
231.article_body: An An, the world's oldest male giant panda under human care, was euthanised on Thursday at the age of 35, a Hong Kong theme park said. The park said his age was equivalent of 105 years for humans. An An and Jia Jia, the world's oldest female giant panda who died in 2016 at 38, were gifts from Chinese government.

232.title: Mumbai youth says he is from D-gang, demands ₹35 lakh from bakery owner
232.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹35 lakh from his former employer, who is a bakery owner in Mumbai. The accused reportedly planned the crime after learning from YouTube and called the complainant on July 9. He claimed he works for gangster Chhota Shakeel and is a part of the D-gang and demanded money from him.

233.title: I wish to see more of Deepak Hooda, he has shown a lot of promise: Ojha
233.article_body: Former India cricketer Pragyan Ojha has said he's curious to see how Deepak Hooda will perform in the three-match ODI series against West Indies, beginning on Friday. "I wish to see more of Deepak Hooda because he has shown a lot of promise," stated Ojha. Hooda has scored 47*, 104 and 33 runs in his last three international games.

234.title: Goa tourism heavily dependent on UK, Russia: Minister Khaunte
234.article_body: Goa Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte said that the coastal state's tourism depends mostly on Britain and Russia, as well as some parts of Europe and added that the state government is taking all measures to get a good footfall. As per reports, British and Russian tourists pay more than other foreign tourists during their stay in the state.

235.title: Expected high-handedness: Cong’s Jairam ahead of Sonia Gandhi’s ED questioning
235.article_body: As Congress has planned to launch a nationwide protest on Thursday as party’s interim President Sonia Gandhi is scheduled to appear before ED, Congress' Jairam Ramesh said Delhi Police is preventing the media from entering Congress party headquarters. "This high-handedness was only to be expected and reflects the mindset of the [PM] Modi Sarkar," Ramesh tweeted.

236.title: Ranil Wickremesinghe sworn in as Sri Lanka's President
236.article_body: Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as Sri Lanka's new President on Thursday at the Parliament complex before Chief Justice Jayantha Jayasuriya. The 73-year-old on Wednesday won 134 votes in the 225-member Parliament after his predecessor Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country and resigned from his post last week. Sri Lanka is facing the worst economic crisis since its independence in 1948.

237.title: Sharad Pawar dissolves all national level departments, cells of NCP
237.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar has dissolved all national level departments and cells of the party, NCP national general secretary Praful Patel said. "All the national level departments and cells...excluding Nationalist Women's Congress, Nationalist Youth Congress and Nationalist Students Congress stand dissolved with immediate effect," Patel tweeted. This decision does not apply to Maharashtra, he added.

238.title: Haryana to conduct judicial inquiry into DSP's death by mining mafia
238.article_body: Haryana government will conduct a judicial inquiry into DSP Surender Singh's death by mining mafia in Nuh, state Home Minister Anil Vij said. A probe will also be conducted against all other circumstances of illegal mining in that area, he added. Singh was allegedly killed by the mafia on Tuesday after he reached the spot basis information about illegal mining.

239.title: Use of AI can help judiciary dispose of pending cases: Guj HC Chief Justice
239.article_body: The use of artificial intelligence (AI) and newer technologies can help the judiciary dispose of thousands of pending cases, Aravind Kumar, Gujarat High Court Chief Justice, said. "Consider Motor Vehicle (MV) cases that account for highest in any court…They can be broadly classified into death cases, grievous injuries cases, simple injuries and for insurance claims," he added.

240.title: More than 500 people die in Spain's record 10-day intense heatwave
240.article_body: Over 500 people have died in Spain during a 10-day heatwave, PM Pedro Sanchez said on Wednesday. According to meteorological agency AEMET, the July 9-18 heatwave was one of the most intense ever recorded in Spain. Sanchez urged citizens to exercise extreme caution, noting that the "climate emergency is a reality". Multiple wildfires have also erupted in Spain amid heatwave.

241.title: Traffic advisory issued in Delhi ahead of Congress' protests over Sonia's ED appearance
241.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police issued an advisory in view of Congress' protests over Sonia Gandhi's appearance before Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday in the National Herald case. "Kindly avoid Motilal Nehru Marg, Akbar Road, Janpath...Man Singh Road between 9 am and 2 pm," Delhi Traffic Police said. Congress had earlier announced that it will hold a nationwide protest on July 21.

242.title: Indian woman missing since 2019 added to FBI's 'Missing Persons' list
242.article_body: The Federal Bureau of Investigation has added a 28-year-old Indian woman, who has been missing from New Jersey for the last three years, to its list of "Missing Persons" and is asking for assistance from the public on her whereabouts. Mayushi Bhagat was last seen in the evening hours of April 29, 2019, leaving her apartment in Jersey City.

243.title: Restarting concessions for senior citizens on trains not desirable: Govt
243.article_body: Restarting concessions to senior citizens on train tickets “is not desirable”, the government said on Wednesday. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in Lok Sabha said that the cost of granting concessions weighs heavily on the railways. Ahead of the lockdown in 2020, the railways had discontinued upto 50% concession previously allowed to senior citizens.

244.title: Incident of fire reported onboard INS Vikramaditya; no casualties
244.article_body: An incident of fire was reported onboard aircraft carrier INS Vikramaditya on Wednesday when it was on a sortie off Karwar in Karnataka, officials said. "The fire was brought under control by the ship's crew using onboard systems. No casualties have been reported," an Indian Navy spokesperson said. An inquiry has been ordered to ascertain the cause of the incident.

245.title: Donald Trump attends ex-wife Ivana Trump's funeral in New York City
245.article_body: The funeral for Ivana Trump, the first wife of ex-US President Donald Trump, was held at St. Vincent Ferrer Church in New York on Wednesday. The former President attended the funeral with his current wife, Melania Trump. Ivana and Donald Trump's children, Ivanka Trump, Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump, also attended the funeral. The 73-year-old died on July 14.

246.title: Over 15,000 people booked in Hyd for number plate tampering since March
246.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police has booked as many as 15,000 people in cases of vehicle number plate tampering since March this year. Most offenders tamper with number plates to evade traffic penalties imposed by police through electronic surveillance, police officials said. Wrong number plates could mislead the law enforcement agencies in detection of any offence, a senior traffic official said.

247.title: Video of woman dancing in Hyderabad metro goes viral; complaint filed
247.article_body: A complaint has been filed against a woman after a video of her dancing on a metro train in Hyderabad for her Instagram Reel went viral online. After many people criticised her on social media, Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited authorities had said that stringent action will be taken against the woman.

248.title: I want to undoubtedly go even bigger and wilder than RRR: Rajamouli
248.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, who directed 'RRR' and the 'Baahubali' film franchise, said he "undoubtedly" wants to go even "bigger" and "wilder" than 'RRR'. "There is never enough for me...To the brink, and nothing less," added Rajamouli. Reacting to criticism over alleged jingoism in his films, Rajamouli stated, "I feel they're just being blind...I don't believe in God [or any religion]."

249.title: Oppn wants limelight by staging protests, doesn’t want discussion: BJP leader
249.article_body: As monsoon session of Parliament is underway, BJP’s Sanjay Jaiswal said that the Opposition does not want any discussion in Parliament. “They just want to get the limelight by staging protests,” he added. His statement came as a response to the question, “How do you view the protests and disruption of proceedings that have taken place?” The Indian Express stated.

250.title: Microsoft Teams down for many users across the globe
250.article_body: Microsoft Teams is facing an outage across the globe, the tech giant has confirmed. "We've received reports of users being unable to access Microsoft Teams or leverage any features. We're investigating the issue and further updates can be found in your Service Health Dashboard," Microsoft 365 Status wrote on Twitter.

251.title: WI ODIs are a big opportunity for India's bench players: RP Singh
251.article_body: With several key players being rested for the ODI series against West Indies, ex-India pacer RP Singh has said that the three-match series is a "big opportunity" for Team India's bench players. "Back-to-back good performances can keep you in the team for a long time," stated Singh. "India [are] aiming to have one replacement for each player," he added.

252.title: It was not Pawar, but Sanjay Raut who broke Shiv Sena: Athawale
252.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale said it was not Sharad Pawar, but Sanjay Raut who caused a split in Shiv Sena. "Uddhav Thackeray decided to go with Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) at the behest of Sanjay Raut," Athawale added. He further said that BJP and Shiv Sena would have formed government in Maharashtra had Shiv Sena and NCP not come together.

253.title: Rahul Dravid expresses importance of home in his life: Piramal Realty
253.article_body: Piramal Realty has unveiled its latest campaign, #TheFutureStartsAtHome, with brand ambassador Rahul Dravid. The campaign aims to highlight the significance of a comfortable home in a family’s flourishment. Through the campaign, the brand has also introduced an offering of 6.75% fixed interest rates on home loans till 2024, to help mitigate the effect of rising interest rates.

254.title: Person who hasn't physically attended classes can't be called an engineer: HC
254.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has said, "A person who hasn't physically attended classes/course and has not undertaken practical training cannot be said to be an engineer." The court said this while setting aside an order of Haryana Police Housing Corporation which promoted an employee to the post of executive engineer who had obtained the degree through distance education mode.

255.title: BJP distributes sweets when child is born at someone else's home: Kamal Nath
255.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath alleged that the BJP "blatantly used police, admin and money" to win in the Madhya Pradesh (MP) municipal elections. Reacting to BJP's celebration after MP municipal poll results, Nath said, "BJP lost seven corporations. If they want to celebrate there is no problem. A child is born at someone else's home and BJP starts distributing sweets."

256.title: India reports 21,566 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 1,48,881
256.article_body: India has reported 21,566 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 20,557 new cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 1,48,881. The COVID-19 death toll has risen to 5,25,870 after 45 persons lost their lives in the last 24 hours.

257.title: Sanjay Dutt's cancer diagnosis came as shock to us: 'Shamshera' director
257.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra opened up about actor Sanjay Dutt's battle with cancer during the film's shoot. "The news that Sanjay sir had been diagnosed with cancer came to all of us like a huge shock. We had no idea about it," he stated. Calling Sanjay a superman, Karan said, "He is an inspiration on the sets for everyone."

258.title: Kohli, Rohit were forced to play away from their body against Topley: Hogg
258.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma were forced to play away from the body when the ball didn't come back in, while batting against England pacer Reece Topley in the recent ODI series. "That was their downfall [against Topley who gets extra bounce]," added Hogg. Topley dismissed Rohit Sharma twice in the three-match ODI series.

259.title: Cases of manhole cover thefts on rise in Mumbai; BMC blames drug addicts
259.article_body: Cases of manhole cover thefts are on a rise in Mumbai this monsoon with police registering over 200 FIRs in the matter. One manhole cover is priced between ₹2,500-₹10,000. According to a BMC official, drug peddlers and drug addicts are more inclined to such thefts. The thieves operate during night and pull the cover using a magnet, the official said.

260.title: Tharoor shares WhatsApp forward on GST on 'Paneer Butter Masala' after hike
260.article_body: As 'Paneer Butter Masala' trended on social media amid controversy over 5% GST on packaged daily use food items, MP Shashi Tharoor shared a WhatsApp forward saying, "This one skewers the folly of the GST as few jokes have!" The Centre has recently imposed 5% GST on daily-use food items, including curd, wheat, pulses, only if they are packed.

261.title: SC allows 27% OBC reservation in Maharashtra local body elections
261.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday allowed 27% reservation for Other Backward Classes (OBCs) in the upcoming local body elections in Maharashtra. "We want elections to be held...we are making it loud and clear to all of you. Let the election process commence," SC told the Maharashtra State Election Commission. The poll process for 367 local bodies has started, SC was informed.

262.title: There might be rivalry between actresses, but it’s good: Raveena Tandon
262.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon said that there might be a rivalry between actresses, however, it's a good and healthy rivalry as it brings out the best in them. "Actresses I've worked with have been friends for so long. It's not necessary for you to get along with everyone," she added while speaking about the rivalry between actresses in the early days.

263.title: Uniting Oppn most crucial thing at the moment: Margaret Alva
263.article_body: Opposition’s Vice President candidate Margaret Alva said she feels that uniting the Opposition is the most crucial thing at the moment. "It’s not a question of winning or losing, it’s a question of responding to a challenge before the nation," she added. "There will be various steps which bring them together, I think this is one of those," Alva stated.

264.title: MCD to levy 'garbage user charges' on more commercial properties
264.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is planning to levy 'garbage user charges' on more number of commercial properties so that its present fee collection of ₹18-₹19 lakh a month increases to about ₹10 crore a month, officials said. The MCD can charge ₹50-₹200 a month as garbage user fee from residential properties depending on their area, according to by-laws.

265.title: 'Revadi culture' may push Gujarat towards Sri Lanka-like crisis: BJP
265.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil warned the public to not get misguided by "revadi culture" of freebies as it could push the state and country into a Sri Lanka-like crisis. Paatil's statement comes after  AAP's national convener Arvind Kejriwal promised free electricity to people if the party is voted to power in Gujarat after this year's Assembly elections.

266.title: Hyderabad Mayor urges GHMC to expedite flood-prevention works
266.article_body: Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal on Wednesday inspected several canal works being carried out under the Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) in LB Nagar zone. She directed officials of the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) to expedite the flood-prevention works while taking all precautionary measures. Gadwal also observed the newly constructed dams at Saroornagar lake.

267.title: 2 bikes, school van catch fire in  24 hours in Pune
267.article_body: Three incidents of vehicles catching fire have been reported in Pune. In the first incident, a TVS Jupiter bike caught fire on the main road near Bharati Vidyapeeth following a technical snag on Wednesday. Another two-wheeler in transit caught fire at Mukund Nagar on Tuesday. A school van that had developed a technical glitch also caught fire near Sundarban society.

268.title: Was in tears after Dennis Lillee said I won't play for SL: Chaminda Vaas
268.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka pacer Chaminda Vaas said he was in "tears" after ex-Australia pacer Dennis Lillee once said that he won't play for his nation. "I [took it as a challenge, going on to represent Sri Lanka] for 15 years," added Vaas. Vaas stated he reminded Lillee about his prediction after playing 60 matches and 100 Tests for Sri Lanka respectively.

269.title: Critic gave half a star to 'Main...', was like 'F**k the reviews': Farah Khan
269.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan recalled a critic's reaction to her directorial debut film 'Main Hoon Na', which starred Shah Rukh Khan. Farah revealed a critic had given her film half a star and the headline read 'Main Hoon Naaaah!'. "It held strongly on Monday...Tuesday (after the first weekend)...I was like 'F**k the reviews. People are loving the film'," she added.

270.title: I'd find every possible way to have both Pant & Karthik in my team: Ponting
270.article_body: Talking about India's possible playing XI for the 2022 T20 World Cup, ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said he would've tried every possible way to have both Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik in his T20I side. "Rishabh to bat, in that three-four-five range, and have Dinesh and Hardik Pandya...[as finishers]," stated Ponting. "I don't think Suryakumar will miss out," he added.

271.title: FIR against Ghatkopar builder for forgery and illegal sale of flats
271.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against builder 'Yog Realty' for misleading 45 tenants of Bhaveshwar Housing Society, Ghatkopar, Mumbai as the flats they were supposed to get in the redeveloped towers were illegally sold to other people. The developer allegedly misled even Bombay High Court on allotments of flats to tenants. The tenants alleged a scam of over ₹15 crore.

272.title: Fake courier service busted in Bengaluru, 4 people arrested
272.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Wednesday busted a fake courier service operating in the city and arrested four accused persons. According to DCP (North East) Anoop A Shetty, the accused used to display google ads with their phone numbers as booking contacts of popular courier companies. "Do not blindly believe whatever is displayed on the top of...Google search," Shetty tweeted.

273.title: Libya resumes oil exports after pause since April
273.article_body: Libya on Wednesday resumed its export of oil after a pause since April. The resumption came after Libya restarted production at oil fields following the firing of the Chairman of the state-run National Oil Corporation by one of the country's rival governments. Tribal leaders aligned with one of the governments had shut down the oil facilities in April.

274.title: Govt reviews situation of 9 states showing rise in COVID-19 cases; names released
274.article_body: Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan reviewed the COVID-19 situation of Kerala, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Assam, Andhra Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, Mizoram and Arunachal Pradesh. "These states are either reporting a surge in new daily COVID-19 cases or a rise in positivity," the Centre said. They were urged to improve testing, increase surveillance and speed up COVID-19 vaccination.

275.title: NZ's Bracewell becomes 1st cricketer to take hat-trick in his 1st ever over in T20Is
275.article_body: New Zealand all-rounder Michael Bracewell has become the first cricketer to take hat-trick in his first-ever over in T20I cricket. The 31-year-old off-spinner dismissed Ireland's Mark Adair, Barry McCarthy and Craig Young in consecutive deliveries to achieve the feat. His figures in the match read 0.5-0-5-3. Overall, he's the third New Zealand cricketer to take hat-trick in men's T20I cricket.

276.title: How does the World Test Championship table read after Pakistan's record victory?
276.article_body: After recording the highest successful Test run chase in Galle to defeat Sri Lanka in the first Test, Pakistan now have 58.33% of points won in the World Test Championship (WTC). Pakistan are on the third position on the WTC points table, while Sri Lanka are sixth with 48.15% of points won. India are fourth on the table.

277.title: Man dressed as elderly woman robs bank in US; police release pictures
277.article_body: Police in US' Georgia have released pictures after a man dressed as an elderly woman robbed a bank. "The suspect...presented a note demanding money. The suspect told the teller he had a gun. The suspect is described as a black male, approximately 6 foot tall and slender," police said. Police added that the suspect was wearing a floral dress.

278.title: RTI activist held over extorting ₹2 cr from highway contractor in Pune
278.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 46-year-old Right to Information (RTI) activist for allegedly trying to extort ₹2 crore from a National Highway road contractor. The complainant's company had got a contract for the construction of a road in Ahmednagar district. The accused complained that the work being done by the complainant's company was illegal and allegedly demanded ₹2 crore.

279.title: Russia expanding its war goals in Ukraine: Russian Foreign Minister
279.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov on Wednesday said that Russia's "special military operation" now went beyond the Donbas region. Lavrov also said that peace talks made no sense at the moment because Western governments were leaning on Ukraine to fight rather than negotiate. In response, Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said, "Russians want blood, not talks."

280.title: 3 held over ₹38 lakh robbery with chilli powder in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar
280.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three men for allegedly robbing two collection agents of ₹38 lakh using chilli powder in Lajpat Nagar's Defence Colony Flyover. The agents were in the area to collect payments from garment traders, police said. They were going back in an auto-rickshaw and the assailants, who were on bikes, threw chilli powder in their eyes, police added.

281.title: 4 arrested in Delhi for extorting money through a Chinese loan app
281.article_body: Delhi Police on Wednesday arrested four persons for allegedly running an extortion racket with two Chinese nationals through a Chinese loan application. The accused had employed 149 people as tele-callers to extort money from people by using their loan applications and sending them morphed photographs. The accused siphoned off an amount of ₹10 crore to the two Chinese nationals.

282.title: 'Whale vomit' worth ₹2.6 crore seized in Mumbai; accused arrested
282.article_body: The Mumbai Crime Branch on Wednesday arrested a man for trying to smuggle ambergris, or 'whale vomit', worth ₹2.6 crore. The police seized 2.8 kg of ambergris from the accused, identified as Vaibhav Janardhan Kalekar. Sale of ambergris is prohibited in India as sperm whales, an endangered species, are protected under the Wildlife Protection Act (WPA) of 1927.

283.title: Five people killed as dumper overturns on an SUV in UP's Raebareli
283.article_body: Two children among five people were killed after a fly ash-filled dumper overturned on an SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli, the police said. They further added that three people were critically injured and are undergoing treatment at a hospital. The bodies of the deceased were taken out with the help of a JCB and sent for post mortem examination.

284.title: 2 men die of electrocution in Shimla, ₹10,000 aid announced
284.article_body: Two men were electrocuted in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla on Wednesday evening, the state disaster management department said. Aman Sharma and Amar Singh were electrocuted while working on an electric pole. The state department said that an instant relief of ₹10,000 each has been given to the family of the two men.

285.title: Tripura CM Manik Saha tests positive for COVID-19
285.article_body: Tripura Chief Minister Dr Manik Saha on Wednesday said that he has tested positive for COVID-19. "I'm absolutely fit and fine with no symptoms. I humbly request all those who've come in contact with me to take necessary precautions," the CM wrote in a Facebook post. Earlier in the day, he inaugurated an oxygen plant at IGM Hospital in Agartala.

286.title: NIA arrests 7th accused in Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh case
286.article_body: The National Investigation Agency on Wednesday arrested the seventh accused in the Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh case. Ali Asgar alias Abdullah, a resident of East Champaran district in Bihar, was arrested after the NIA conducted searches in Bihar in connection with the case. Asgar is a radicalized individual involved in propagating jihad by posting incriminating materials online, the NIA said.

287.title: Karnataka CM Bommai assures funds for Cauvery Basin development
287.article_body: The Chief Minister of Karnataka Basavaraj Bommai said that financial grants would be provided for developmental works in the Cauvery Basin. Bommai expressed his happiness at KRS and Kabini dams being filled to the brim this year. Responding to Tamil Nadu CM's statement for an emergency meeting over the Mekedatu project, Bommai said he would issue a statement soon.

288.title: Tanushree claims she's being harassed by Bollywood mafia, says 'I won't die by suicide'
288.article_body: Tanushree Dutta has claimed that she's being "harassed and targeted very badly". She added that she won't die by suicide and she'll resurrect her career. "Bollywood Mafia, the old political circuit of Maharashtra...and nefarious anti-national criminal elements together usually operate like this to trouble people. I'm very sure the #metoo culprits...are behind all this," said Tanushree.

289.title: US-Africa summit to be held in December: Biden
289.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday said the United States will host an African nations summit in December to discuss food security and climate change. The US-Africa Leaders Summit will be held from December 13 to 15 and about 50 African leaders are expected to participate. Separately, the US has announced $1.3 billion aid for Ethiopia, Kenya and Somalia.

290.title: Jasprit Bumrah loses world number one ODI bowler spot to Trent Boult
290.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday released the latest rankings for men's ODI bowlers. India pacer Jasprit Bumrah, who didn't feature in India's third ODI against England, dropped to the second spot in the rankings. New Zealand fast bowler Trent Boult replaced him as the world number one ODI bowler. Meanwhile, India leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal jumped four spots to the 16th position

291.title: Which departments have highest no. of vacancies out of 9.79 lakh vacant posts in Centre?
291.article_body: The Centre informed Lok Sabha that there are around 9.79 lakh vacant posts in various ministries/departments of central government, as per the Annual Report of Pay Research Unit of Department of Expenditure. As per the report, Railways Ministry has the highest vacancies (2.93 lakh), followed by Defence Ministry (Civilian- 2.64 lakh), Home Ministry (1.43 lakh) and Department of Post (90,050).

292.title: BJP workers hold protest after girls told to remove bras at NEET centre
292.article_body: A protest was held on Wednesday outside the NEET exam centre where female students had allegedly been told to take off their bras before taking the exam. Protesters, purportedly belonging to Kerala BJP, were seen carrying BJP flags outside Mar Thoma Institute of Information Technology. Earlier, a student's parent filed a complaint about the removal of innerwear with Kollam SP.

293.title: No forced child labour cases during lockdown: Centre
293.article_body: The Rajya Sabha was informed that there were no cases of children who were forced to leave their homes for illegal child labour during the lockdown reported to child rights body NCPCR. Union Minister Smriti Irani said that 330 railway stations have been equipped with CCTVs and monitoring rooms. NCPCR has received 617 child kidnapping complaints since 2020.

294.title: 2012 batch IAS officer K Srinivas appointed Bengaluru Urban DC
294.article_body: K Srinivas, a 2012 batch IAS officer, has taken charge as Bengaluru Urban district deputy commissioner. The post fell vacant after incumbent J Manjunath was arrested earlier this month for allegedly taking ₹5 lakh bribe. The deputy commissioner's position is quasi-judicial with powers to resolve land disputes and issue no-objection certificates.

295.title: Suspects who set on fire Lankan Prez's home sent to judicial custody
295.article_body: The four suspects who allegedly set ablaze the residence of Sri Lanka's newly-elected President Ranil Wickremesinghe in Colombo have been sent to judicial custody till July 27. The suspects were arrested on July 10 and will be produced for identification parade on July 27. Wickremesinghe said the July 9 fire had destroyed over 4,000 books and his 125-year-old piano.

296.title: BJP govt in UP invoking NSA even in trivial cases: BSP chief
296.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday said the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh was invoking National Security Act (NSA) even in trivial cases, in order to cover up its failure to control crime. "Criminals associated with the ruling party are roaming freely," Mayawati said. "In such a situation, how can rule of law be established in the state?" she added.

297.title: Water purifier firm DrinkPrime raises ₹60 crore in Series A round
297.article_body: Water purifier subscription company DrinkPrime has raised ₹60 crore in its Series A funding round. The round saw participation from Omidyar Network India, Surge Sequoia and 9Unicorns. According to its Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer Vijender Reddy Muthyala, the company's goal is to make safe drinking water accessible to the majority of India.

298.title: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande meets Bangladesh PM
298.article_body: Indian Army chief General Manoj Pande paid a visit to Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina at the latter's residence in Dhaka. The Indian Army chief is on a three-day visit to Bangladesh at the invitation of his counterpart General SM Shafiuddin Ahmed. General Pande is being accompanied by a three-member delegation and his wife Archana Pande.

299.title: Roads melt into sticky, black goo amid record-breaking temperatures in UK, pics surface
299.article_body: Several roads in the UK melted into a sticky, black goo amid record-breaking heatwave in the UK. A local in Manchester said that it looked like cars were "driving through water". "It was that soft your feet got stuck in it if you walked across. The tarmac was all stuck in the treads of my tyres," the local stated.

300.title: Cong showing destructive attitude towards democracy: Union Minister
300.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday criticised Congress for disrupting proceedings in the Parliament. He added that the government is not running away from debate on price rise and such issues can be taken up once Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman recovers from COVID-19. He alleged there was a competition among Opposition parties on who would disrupt Parliament the most.

301.title: Mexican beauty queen, accomplice held for $1.7mn wine theft in Europe
301.article_body: An ex-Mexican beauty pageant contestant and a Romanian-Dutch accomplice have been arrested in Croatia over theft of $1.7 million worth of bottles of wine after nine-month chase across Europe. The accused reportedly stole 45 vintage wine bottles from a hotel in Spain. Spanish authorities worked with counterparts in Netherlands, Croatia and Romania to catch the pair, who haven't been identified.

302.title: 3 men die of electrocution in TN, CM announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia
302.article_body: Three men, aged between 40-45 years, died of electrocution in Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram district, after coming in contact with an electric fence put up in a farm area. The fence was reportedly put up by a farmer to tackle the menace of wild boars. CM MK Stalin ordered an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh to each of the three families.

303.title: UN accuses Taliban of extrajudicial killings & torture since takeover
303.article_body: The UN in a report on Wednesday accused the Taliban of extrajudicial killings, torture, arbitrary arrests and inhumane punishments since their takeover last year. The violations were targeted at a number of groups, including former government officials, human rights defenders and journalists, the report said. However, a spokesman for the Taliban government rejected the report's findings.

304.title: Italian PM Draghi to stay in office if allies recommit to unity
304.article_body: Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi on Wednesday said he would rescind his resignation offer if his coalition partners recommit to unity. Last week, Draghi offered to resign after senators of ally 5-Star Movement boycotted a confidence vote. In recent days, citizens from all corners have urged Draghi to stay in office as Italy battles soaring inflation.

305.title: Heatwaves to become more frequent, will continue till 2060s: UN
305.article_body: Amid heatwaves in Europe, UN said that heatwaves will become more frequent and are likely to continue until 2060s irrespective of climate mitigation efforts. "Emissions are still growing...especially in...big Asian countries which are...largest emitters," UN's World Meteorological Organization chief said. Notably, UK reported its hottest day on July 19 as temperatures crossed 40°C for first time.

306.title: Sri Lanka seeks UK intelligence help in Easter Sunday attack probe
306.article_body: Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was elected Sri Lanka's President on Wednesday, has sought the assistance of the British intelligence services to complete the probe of the Easter Sunday suicide attacks in 2019. Wickremesinghe said the absence of proper investigation of the attacks meant the issue was not yet resolved. The suicide attacks had killed nearly 270 people in the island nation.

307.title: MVA govt didn't implement schemes for minorities properly: Maha SP
307.article_body: The Maharashtra unit of Samajwadi Party on Wednesday criticised the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi government and said it failed to implement important schemes of the minority ministry properly. "We've evaluated the performance of...schemes...being run by the state Minority Department," SP MLA Rais Shaikh said. "In nearly 19 of them, the utilisation of funds is less than 50%," he added.

308.title: RPF seized drugs worth ₹40.58 cr from 2019 to 2021; arrested 1,108: Govt
308.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) recovered narcotics worth ₹40.58 crore in the last three years, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. In a written reply to a question in Lok Sabha, he said between 2019 and 2021, the RPF registered 1,262 cases related to narcotics and arrested 1,108 people. The seized narcotics were handed over to the agencies empowered to investigate.

309.title: Man, his 66-yr-old grandmother stabbed in Delhi after row with 2 men
309.article_body: A 22-year-old man and his 66-year-old grandmother were allegedly stabbed in South Delhi's Mehrauli. The youth said two men were shouting and using abusive language near his house on Tuesday, following which his grandmother asked them to leave the place. Thereafter, a scuffle took place between them and the men later came with their associates to attack them, he added.

310.title: Turkish airstrikes kill 8 in Iraq, over 20 injured
310.article_body: Airstrikes by Turkey killed eight tourists and wounded over a dozen people in northern Iraq on Wednesday, Iraqi Kurdish officials said. The semi-autonomous Kurdish-run district of Zakho was targeted in the attack. The Kurdistan Worker's Party has led insurgency in southeast Turkey since 1984 and is listed as a terrorist organisation by Turkey, the United States and the European Union.

311.title: Cong not letting DK Shivakumar function as KPCC President: K'taka CM
311.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday criticised Congress and said the party is not letting DK Shivakumar function as KPCC President. "Shivakumar has been nursing the dream of becoming the CM...We've been watching what is happening in Congress," Bommai said. This comes after DK Shivakumar on Tuesday said Congress coming to power was more important than him becoming the CM.

312.title: 9.8 lakh posts vacant in central govt departments as on Mar 1, 2021: Govt
312.article_body: Nearly 9.8 lakh posts in central government departments were vacant as of March 1, 2021, Union Minister of State Jitendra Singh informed the Lok Sabha on Wednesday. Of the 40,35,203 sanctioned posts, 30,55,876 were filled, Singh said. "All ministries/departments of...central government have been requested to take action in a mission mode for filling up of vacant posts," he added.

313.title: Ukraine asks international creditors to freeze debt payment amid war
313.article_body: Ukraine has asked its international creditors to freeze its debt payments for two years due to the ongoing war with Russia. The Ukrainian Finance Ministry on Wednesday said that it was hoping to finalise the deferral on its roughly $20 billion of debt by August 9. Notably, Ukraine plans to offer lenders additional interest payments once the freeze ends.

314.title: EU publishes emergency plan in case Russia cuts off gas supply
314.article_body: The European Commission on Wednesday published emergency plan to immediately decrease gas demand in the European Union countries as fear of Russia cutting off supplies looms ahead of winter. Commission chief Ursula von der Leyen said Russia was "using energy as a weapon" amidst the Ukraine war. The emergency plan asks all EU members to reduce gas demand by 15%.

315.title: Nearly 4 lakh Indians gave up citizenship between 2019-2021: Govt
315.article_body: Over 3.9 lakh Indians renounced their citizenship between 2019-2021 with the US emerging as the most preferred choice, the Ministry of Home Affairs said. According to the ministry, 1,400 people moved to China and 48 people moved to Pakistan in the same period. In the last year, 78,000 Indians renounced their citizenship to move to the US.

316.title: Fintech startup Slice shifts to term loans after RBI directive
316.article_body: Fintech startup Slice is changing its lending model and will now offer real-time term loans to customers for each transaction. This moves from its previous model where Slice offered a pre-approved credit line to customers to use as per their discretion. This comes after an RBI mandate prohibited loading credit lines into prepaid payment instruments like wallets and prepaid cards.

317.title: Nepal civic group urges govt to reclaim land encroached by China
317.article_body: A civic group in Nepal on Tuesday submitted a memorandum to the Nepalese government, urging it to reclaim country's territory occupied by China. "The encroachment in various areas of...Nepal-China border, including Ruila...is...a direct challenge to the sovereignty of Nepal," the memorandum read. Nepal and China reportedly have territorial disputes in districts of Humla, Gorkha and Sankhuwasabha.

318.title: Scindia shares video of India's 1st pilot-less passenger-carrying drone 'Varuna'
318.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia took to Twitter to share a video of India's first pilot-less passenger-carrying drone 'Varuna'. "Drones now will not just be only cargo carriers but also human carriers!" he wrote. He further said that 'Varuna' can carry weight of 130 kg and travel 25 km at a time.

319.title: Healthtech startup Fitterfly raises $12 mn in Series A funding
319.article_body: Mumbai-based healthtech startup Fitterfly has raised $12 million in a Series A funding round. Led by Amazon Smbhav Venture Fund and Fireside Ventures, the round saw participation from 9 Unicorns, Venture Catalysts, Nihar Parikh of 4point0 Health Ventures, and Sriram Natarajan of Molbio. The startup, founded in 2016 by Dr Arbinder Singal and Shailesh Gupta, has over 200 employees.

320.title: Automation platform AppViewX raises $20 mn in Series B round
320.article_body: Seattle-based automation startup, AppViewX, raised $20 million in a Series B funding round led by existing investor Brighton Park Capital. The startup has also announced that it will be inaugurating its 100-seater global centre of excellence in Bengaluru. The firm will use the capital to maximise its go-to-market operations and product development and overall revenue growth strategies.

321.title: Alt News Co-founder Zubair released from jail 24 days after arrest
321.article_body: Fact-checker and Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair was released from Delhi's Tihar Jail on Wednesday, 24 days after he was arrested over a 2018 tweet. Earlier in the day, the Supreme Court granted interim bail to Zubair in all six FIRs registered against him in Uttar Pradesh. The court had ordered his release at 6 pm on Wednesday.

322.title: Syria breaks diplomatic ties with Ukraine in reciprocal measure
322.article_body: Syria on Wednesday formally broke diplomatic relations with Ukraine in response to a similar move by Ukraine days earlier. Syria, which is a close ally of Russia, recognised two Ukrainian separatist regions of Donetsk and Luhansk as independent last month, following which Ukraine broke ties with the country. Russia had recognised these regions as independent before invading Ukraine.

323.title: 118 civilians killed in J&K since August 2019: Centre
323.article_body: Since the abrogation of Article 370 in 2019, 118 civilians have been killed in Jammu and Kashmir including five Kashmiri Pandits and 16 other Hindus and Sikhs. Union Minister of State Nityanand Rai said that no Pandit has migrated from J&K since August 2019. He added that there has been a decline in the number of terror attacks since 2018.

324.title: Rainbow coloured pic of Pluto shared by NASA, social media users react
324.article_body: NASA shared a translated colour image of Pluto, created by New Horizons scientists to highlight colour differences between its distinct regions. "Pluto has a complex...surface with jumbled mountains, carved-out valleys, old, heavily cratered terrain sitting right next to...icy plains," wrote NASA. "Pluto is where the party's at," a comment read while another person wrote, "This is so beautiful!"

325.title: 5 arrested for allegedly torching UP building in 1984 anti-Sikh riots
325.article_body: A Special Investigation Team on Wednesday arrested five men who are accused of setting a building on fire in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. Three people had been burnt to death in the fire. The arrested men, all residents of Kidwai Nagar, have been identified as Anil Kumar Pandey, Sriram, Mustaqeem, Abdul Waheed and Irshad Khan.

326.title: OnePlus to launch OnePlus 10T 5G and OxygenOS 13 on August 3
326.article_body: OnePlus announced that its second flagship smartphone of 2022, the OnePlus 10T 5G along with the all new OxygenOS 13 will be launched in New York City on August 3. The OnePlus 10T is powered by the Snapdragon®️ 8+ Gen 1 Mobile Platform, while OxygenOS 13 comes with refreshed design, AODs, Zen Mode and enhanced gaming, connectivity, and safety.

327.title: Xiaomi India launches Redmi K50i 5G smartphone & Redmi Earbuds 3 Lite
327.article_body: Xiaomi India has launched Redmi K50i 5G, starting at ₹25,999. The ultimate 'India-ready 5G' phone comes with flagship MediaTek Dimensity 8100 chipset, 144Hz 7-stage AdaptiveSync FFS Display, triple-camera setup, 5080mAh battery, 67W in-box turbocharger, Dolby Vision™️ & Dolby Atmos®️ certification, the brand stated. Available on mi.com & Amazon.in, Xiaomi also launched Redmi Buds 3 Lite at ₹1,999.

328.title: UP Minister Dinesh Khatik resigns, says 'was sidelined because I am a Dalit'
328.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister of State for Jal Shakti Dinesh Khatik on Wednesday resigned from his post alleging that he was sidelined because he is a Dalit. He sent his resignation letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah instead of CM Yogi Adityanath. "My working as a minister of state is... waste for the Dalit community," Khatik said in the letter.

329.title: 13 lakh electric vehicles registered in country: Nitin Gadkari
329.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Wednesday informed the Rajya Sabha that over 13 lakh electric vehicles are registered in the country. However, the number excludes data from Andhra Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Telangana and Lakshadweep. Under Faster Adoption and Manufacturing of Electric Vehicles (FAME) Phase-II scheme, 2,877 public EV charging stations have been sanctioned in 68 cities, Gadkari said.

330.title: Door-to-door checking done: Haryana Home Minister on DSP's killing
330.article_body: A day after DSP Surender Singh was killed by mining mafia in Haryana's Nuh, Home Minister Anil Vij said door-to-door checking was done to arrest the accused. "We're investigating the matter. We're taking strict measures to ensure law and order in the state," he said. The accused truck driver was arrested from Rajasthan's Bharatpur, Anil Vij said.

331.title: Delhi HC allows minor rape victim to terminate 26-week pregnancy
331.article_body: Delhi HC has allowed a minor rape victim to undergo medical termination of her 26-week pregnancy, saying her misery would stand compounded if she was forced to become a mother at a tender age. Forcing the victim to go through the pregnancy would scar her psyche, the Court observed. It also directed hospital to preserve terminal foetus for DNA testing.

332.title: Rishi Sunak among final 2 contenders for UK PM, wins most votes in latest voting round
332.article_body: Former British Finance Minister Rishi Sunak and Foreign Secretary Liz Truss on Wednesday made it through to final stage of the leadership contest to replace Prime Minister Boris Johnson. Sunak won the fifth voting round of Tory MPs with 137 votes, while second-placed Truss won the support of 113 MPs. Former Defence Secretary Penny Mordaunt was eliminated with 105 votes.

333.title: Hope Pant takes care of his weight; he can emerge as a model, earn in crores: Akhtar
333.article_body: Former Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is a little overweight. He added, "I hope he takes care of that. Because India's market is big. He's good-looking. He can emerge as a model, earn in crores." Akhtar further said, "In times to come, Rishabh Pant is going to be a superstar."

334.title: TRS workers protest against GST on packaged milk, dairy products
334.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leaders and workers took to the streets across the state on Wednesday to protest against the Centre's decision to impose Goods and Services Tax (GST) on packaged milk and dairy products. "The party condemns the anti-people policies of the Centre and will continue to resist till a rollback is announced," TRS MLA Danam Nagender said.

335.title: 472 kg marijuana worth ₹47 lakh seized in Assam's Karimganj, 1 held
335.article_body:
Police on Tuesday night seized 472 kg of marijuana worth ₹47 lakh from a truck in Karimganj district along the Assam-Tripura border and arrested one person in connection with the case. 
"The truck was coming from Tripura side...We apprehended the truck driver identified as Sajala Debbarman," Niranjan Das, in-charge of Churaibari police watch post, said.

336.title: J&K makes face masks, social distancing mandatory amid COVID surge
336.article_body: As COVID-19 cases spike in Jammu and Kashmir, wearing masks and social distancing have been made mandatory in all public places including colleges, schools, markets, multiplexes and banks. The Deputy Commissioner of Jammu issued a circular stating that officials must ensure that all preventive measures are implemented. Jammu and Kashmir reported 333 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours.

337.title: Police kills arms smuggler in encounter in Assam
337.article_body: An arms smuggler named Adam Ali was killed in an encounter with Assam Police on Tuesday. Police had launched a search operation on Tuesday in Dhubri, where Ali had taken shelter. "When the police team reached the area...Ali fired and the police team retaliated," SP Abhijit Gurav said. "[Ali] was involved in anti-national activity, Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen...arms smuggling [and] hawala," he added.

338.title: Wipro's net profit falls 21% YoY to ₹2,564 cr in Q1, revenue up 16%
338.article_body: Wipro Limited on Wednesday reported a 20.93% YoY decline in its consolidated profit after tax to ₹2,563.6 crore for the March-June quarter. The company's consolidated revenue, however, rose 15.51% YoY to ₹22,001 crore in Q1 FY23, up from ₹19,045 crore in Q1 FY22. "At 15% of operating margins, we believe that we have bottomed out," said Wipro CFO Jatin Dalal.

339.title: Truck driver who ran over DSP amid mining raid in Haryana arrested from Rajasthan
339.article_body: Haryana Police on Wednesday arrested the truck driver who allegedly ran over DSP Surender Singh during an illegal mining check in Nuh a day ago. The accused named Mittar was nabbed from Rajasthan's Bharatpur, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said. The DSP had signalled a stone-laden truck to slow down, but the driver instead sped up and ran him over.

340.title: 4 dead as ambulance carrying patient crashes at K'taka toll booth, incident caught on CCTV
340.article_body: An ambulance carrying a patient and two attendants lost control and crashed into a toll booth in Karnataka's Udupi district today, killing all three and a toll attendant. The driver was injured, police said. In the video footage, some men who appear to be toll operators can be seen scurrying to remove three plastic barricades on seeing the ambulance approach.

341.title: 742 kms of metro rail lines operational in 19 cities: Govt report
341.article_body: Nearly 742 kilometres of metro rail lines are operational in 19 cities across the country, according to a parliamentary panel report. About 1,037 kilometres of metro rail lines are being laid in 27 cities, the report said. Cities like Varanasi, Thiruvananthapuram, Kozhikode, Guwahati and Chandigarh are aspiring to have a metro rail system, the report added.

342.title: 2 dead, 2,642 held from rly premises over Agnipath protests: Govt
342.article_body: Two people died, 35 were injured and 2,642 were arrested from railway premises during the protests against the Agnipath scheme, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw informed the Parliament on Wednesday. The minister said because of strikes and agitations, the railways has incurred a loss of ₹151 crore in 2019-20, ₹904 crore in 2020-21 and ₹62 crore in 2021-22.

343.title: Hope to complete Sri Lanka aid talks as soon as possible: IMF chief
343.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) hopes to complete negotiations with Sri Lanka on a bailout package "as quickly as possible", IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva said. "The moment there is a government [in Sri Lanka], we can continue our discussions and our team will be there," Georgieva said. Sri Lanka needs about $5 billion in next six months to cover basic necessities.

344.title: Which are the world's most peaceful countries as India is ranked 135th?
344.article_body: As per the recently released Global Peace Index (GPI) 2022, which ranks 163 of the world's nations in terms of 'peacefulness', India has been ranked 135th. Iceland has been named the most peaceful country, while New Zealand has been ranked the second-most peaceful country. New Zealand is followed by Ireland, Denmark, Austria, Portugal, Slovenia, Czech Republic and Singapore.

345.title: SC to hear AAP's plea against postponement of MCD polls on July 26
345.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said it will hear on July 26 the Aam Aadmi Party's plea challenging the postponement of Municipal Corporations of Delhi elections. The AAP's representative said the three municipal corporations in Delhi have been unified and their terms expired in May this year. Delimitation shouldn't be the sole reason to postpone the polls, the AAP contended.

346.title: Govt shares state-wise list of employment generated by DPIIT-recognised startups
346.article_body: The government told Lok Sabha that Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)-recognised startups have generated nearly 7.68 lakh jobs since Startup India initiative was launched in 2016.
