As per a list, such startups in Maharashtra created 1.46 lakh jobs, followed by Karnataka (1.03 lakh jobs) and Delhi (87,643 jobs). Uttar Pradesh came fourth with 67,694 jobs.

347.title: B'desh PM invites Mamata to visit newly-constructed Padma Bridge
347.article_body: Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina has invited West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to come and see the newly-constructed Padma Bridge there. "This bridge is expected to strengthen bilateral ties between Bangladesh and West Bengal, or rather entire India and open up new avenues for bilateral trade," Hasina wrote in a letter to Banerjee. Notably, the 6.51-km-long bridge is Bangladesh's longest bridge.

348.title: Ex-K'taka minister Eshwarappa cleared of all charges in contractor suicide case
348.article_body: Former Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa was on Wednesday cleared of all charges by the police in connection with the alleged suicide of civil contractor Santosh Patil in April this year. In WhatsApp messages to his friends and the media, Patil had blamed Eshwarappa for his death. Recently, Patil's wife wrote to the Governor seeking a transparent investigation into the case.

349.title: Poor quality water being consumed in parts of Bengaluru
349.article_body: Poor quality water is being consumed in parts of Bengaluru with total dissolved solids and water hardness levels exceeding permissible limits in Electronic City, HSR Layout and Whitefield areas, according to a recent study. High TDS levels in water can cause nausea, lung irritation, among other health problems. The study used water samples taken between January and May this year.

350.title: NIA conducts raid in Madrasa, arrests teacher in Bihar
350.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) conducted a raid in Jamia Maria Niswa Madrasa and arrested a teacher named Asghar Ali in Bihar's Purvi Champaran district. NIA also recovered five bags full of books from Ali's house. This comes after police busted a potential terror module in Bihar and arrested accused with links to Islamic extremist outfit Popular Front of India (PFI).

351.title: Woman's body found stuffed inside iron box in Punjab, husband held
351.article_body: The Punjab Police on Tuesday arrested a man for the alleged murder of his wife after her body was found hidden inside a box in Ludhiana. ASI Satpal Singh said the woman's family, after not being able to reach the couple, reached their house. They checked the rooms and found the deceased's body inside an iron box, Singh added.

352.title: Govt approves 6,000 transit shelters for Kashmiri migrants in J&K
352.article_body: Centre has approved construction of 6,000 transit shelters for Kashmiri migrants employed in the valley under a special package of the prime minister, Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai told Rajya Sabha on Wednesday. "Construction of 1,025 units has been completed or substantially completed," he added. Rai also said the government has acquired land for various public purposes.

353.title: B'luru woman with heart issue airlifted from US to Chennai in 26 hrs
353.article_body: A 67-year-old woman with a critical heart condition was airlifted from Portland in the United States to Chennai in a 26-hour long flight, becoming one of the longest aero-medical evacuations to India. The airlift cost the family $133,000 (a little over ₹1 crore), reports said. The woman was transported to Chennai in two separate private jets, reports added.

354.title: Faridabad Police arrests 5 for cheating 335 on pretext of giving jobs
354.article_body: Faridabad Police on Sunday arrested five men for allegedly duping 335 people across the country on the pretext of providing them with jobs. The accused would contact job seekers by posing as recruiters and ask them to deposit various fees after conducting job interviews, according to the police. The police have recovered ₹3.97 lakh from the accused.

355.title: 'Pad Man' producer Prerna Arora charged with money laundering in alleged fraud of ₹31cr
355.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has registered a case of money laundering against producer Prerna Arora, known for producing films including 'Pad Man' and 'Toilet - Ek Prem Katha'. Prerna allegedly faces fraud charges of ₹31 crore. ED summoned her today but she didn't appear as she's not in Mumbai. On her behalf, her lawyer reached the ED office and sought time.

356.title: Girl with rare condition undergoes surgery in Delhi to fix spine curvature
356.article_body: A 12-year-old girl from Kyrgyzstan with an extremely deformed spine underwent surgery at a private hospital in Delhi that reduced her spine curvature from 130 degrees to 30 degrees, according to a statement. The girl suffers from Progressive Dorsolumbar Scoliosis, a rare condition that affects about three children out of every one lakh.

357.title: 2 killed, 8 injured as under-construction bridge collapses in U'khand
357.article_body: Two labourers were killed and eight were injured after an under-construction bridge collapsed on Rishikesh-Badrinath highway in Uttarakhand on Wednesday morning, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) said. "Two people died on the spot," SDRF spokesperson said. Rudraprayag DM, who visited the spot along with the officials concerned, said a high-level probe will be conducted into the matter.

358.title: Armed gunmen shoot 29 dogs dead in Qatar, injure many others
358.article_body: A group of armed gunmen stormed a secure factory area in Qatar and shot 29 dogs dead and injured many others. The gunmen claimed they shot dogs dead because a dog had bitten the son of a gunman, Doha-based animal rescue charity Paws Rescue Qatar said. "I'm genuinely shocked," a social media user commented, while another wrote, "It's barbaric."

359.title: Virat Kohli & Rohit Sharma drop in latest rankings for ODI batters, Pant jumps 25 places
359.article_body: The ICC on Wednesday announced the latest rankings for ODI batters. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma dropped down one place each to be ranked fourth and fifth, respectively. Meanwhile, Rishabh Pant, who slammed his maiden ODI hundred in the third ODI against England, jumped 25 places to be ranked 52nd. Further, Hardik Pandya jumped eight places to be ranked 42nd.

360.title: PMC to levy value-based property tax on 100 properties on pilot basis
360.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will levy value-based property tax on 100 properties on a pilot basis. This is being done in an attempt to bridge the gap in the amount of property tax levied on old and new properties. Currently, property tax is levied as per the ready reckoner rate of the year of the concerned property's registration.

361.title: Maha CM Eknath Shinde stakes claim over Shiv Sena, sends letter to EC
361.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday night approached the Election Commission of India (ECI), staking claim over the Shiv Sena. CM Shinde on Tuesday said Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has recognised rebel Shiv Sena MP Rahul Shewale as the party's floor leader in the Lower House of Parliament. Sanjay Raut on Tuesday called Shinde's faction "snakes".

362.title: 7 flights diverted, 40 delayed at Delhi airport after heavy rainfall
362.article_body: As heavy rains lashed Delhi on Wednesday, as many as seven flights were diverted and 40 were delayed at Delhi airport, as per reports. Vistara said its two Mumbai-Delhi flights were diverted to Jaipur and Indore due to heavy rainfall. Many parts of Delhi were waterlogged and traffic was affected in many areas after the rainfall.

363.title: PM Modi meets PT Usha after she takes oath in Parliament, shares pic
363.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met renowned former athlete PT Usha in Parliament after the latter took oath as Rajya Sabha MP on Wednesday. The Prime Minister shared a picture of him standing beside Usha on Twitter. He tweeted, "Glad to have met PT Usha ji in Parliament." Usha, 58, has won 18 gold medals for India at several international events.

364.title: Cheetahs to return to Indian forests for 1st time in nearly 70 yrs
364.article_body: India and Namibia on Wednesday signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to reintroduce cheetahs in the country after nearly seven decades. As per the agreement with Namibia, India will get eight cheetahs in two batches of four. MP's Kuno National Park is likely to receive the first tranche of cheetahs by August 15.

365.title: Hand over AIADMK headquarter keys to EPS: Madras HC to Tamil Nadu govt
365.article_body: The Madras High Court on Wednesday asked the Tamil Nadu government to hand over keys of AIADMK headquarters to Interim General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami, also known as EPS. The court asked AIADMK cadres not to enter the office for one month to prevent untoward incidents. The office was sealed after a clash between supporters of EPS and O Panneerselvam.

366.title: Be fair: AAP MP urges Centre to give representation to Punjab in MSP panel
366.article_body: AAP MP Vikramjit Singh Sahney on Wednesday urged the Centre to "be fair" and include representatives from Punjab in the committee constituted on the minimum support price (MSP) along with the Commission for Agricultural Costs & Prices (CACP). Avoiding a dialogue with representatives of Punjab will not serve the purpose, Sahney said.

367.title: National Lok Adalat to be held in Noida on August 13
367.article_body: A National Lok Adalat will be organised in Noida on August 13, the district administration said on Tuesday. District Magistrate Suhas LY said that various cases, including criminal compoundable suit, family disputes and water bill payment disputes, will be adjudicated by the Lok Adalat. He also called upon people to turn out in large numbers and avail of this opportunity.

368.title: Gang of inter-state contract killers arrested for murder in Hyderabad
368.article_body: Four inter-state contract killers, who executed the murder of a businessman on the outskirts of Hyderabad five days ago, were arrested, the Rachakonda Police tweeted. Police said the accused killed a businessman, Ambati Raghupathi, for ₹30 lakh on July 15 at Dammaiguda. The prime accused in the case, 33-year-old Srikanth Reddy, was also arrested by the police.

369.title: EAM Jaishankar to address UNGA session in September
369.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will address the annual UN General Assembly session on September 24, according to the UN's provisional list of speakers. The General Debate of the 77th Session of the UNGA will be held from September 20 to 26. The Russia-Ukraine war and the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic are expected to be discussed at the annual meet.

370.title: CWG 2022-bound Indian athletes Dhanalakshmi, Aishwarya Babu fail dope test: Reports
370.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022-bound athletes Dhanalakshmi and Aishwarya Babu have failed dope test, as per reports. Sprinter Dhanalakshmi returned positive for a banned steroid, while Aishwarya returned positive for a banned substance after NADA officials took her sample during National Inter-State Athletics Championships last month. Aishwarya had broken the triple jump national record during the meet.

371.title: Satisfy hunger with tadka of jumlas: Rahul on GST on essential items
371.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi took a jibe at PM Narendra Modi over GST on packaged food items and said that PM will have to take back the move. "Recipe of Gabbar for people struggling with inflation: Make less, eat less, satisfy hunger with the tadka of jumlas," he said. Packaged food weighing less than 25kg will carry 5% GST.

372.title: Odisha STF seizes leopard skin, 1 arrested
372.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of Odisha Police seized a leopard skin and arrested one person on charges of smuggling in Koraput, officials said on Wednesday. Based on a tip-off, a team of STF conducted a raid with the help of Ramgir Forest Officials near Ramgir Gupteswar Gate. Since 2020, the STF has arrested 43 wildlife criminals, an official said.

373.title: B'luru Police rescue boy within 3 hours of his abduction; 4 held
373.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Tuesday rescued a 19-year-old college student within three hours of his abduction and arrested four of the alleged perpetrators, with assistance from the Chitradurga Police. The vehicle carrying the abducted teen, Jagadish, was tracked down by the police using FASTag details. Jagadish was abducted as his father owed one of the accused around ₹3 crore, probe found.

374.title: Venture capital firm First Cheque closes second fund at $5 mn
374.article_body: Early-stage venture capital firm First Cheque has raised $5 million from global investors for its second fund. Before the fund was launched, First Cheque operated as an AngelList Syndicate and invested in more than 100 startups in the last three years. The firm is looking to back first-time founders and will invest $100,000 in each of its portfolio companies.

375.title: Agritech startup Growcoms raises $1 mn in pre-Series A fund
375.article_body: Kochi-based agritech startup, Growcoms, has raised $1 million in its pre-Series A funding round led by Info Edge. The firm, supported by Kerala Startup Mission and incubated in Indigram Labs Foundation, was founded in 2021 by George Kurian Kannanthanam, Bibin Mathews and Narendranath P. The firm focuses on making farmers aware about enhancing the quality of produce, said Co-founder Kannanthanam.

376.title: Follow ringmaster US Federal Reserve to save local currency: Uday Kotak
376.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank CEO Uday Kotak on Tuesday said central banks which don't follow "ringmaster US Federal Reserve" have their local currencies crushed. "Look at Japan, a 30%+ depreciation. That's the power of the US $," Kotak tweeted. He added that central banks globally take a cue from the US Federal Reserve and decide their monetary policies accordingly.

377.title: Kolkata residents allege air pollution due to cats; NGT forms panel
377.article_body: Residents of an apartment in Kolkata have alleged that droppings, hair and dander of cats kept by a flat owner were causing air pollution. National Green Tribunal has formed a three-member panel to look into the matter. The residents said that the flat owner has 20 to 25 cats and she feeds 15 to 20 stray cats in the corridor.

378.title: HC orders handing of AIADMK headquarters' keys to Palaniswami
378.article_body: Madras High Court on Wednesday ordered to hand over the keys of AIADMK headquarters to current AIADMK Interim General Secretary Edappadi Palaniswami. The court stated that the party cadres or workers are not allowed to enter the headquarters for a month. The headquarters, 'MGR Maaligai', was sealed earlier this month after violence erupted between supporters of Palaniswami and O Panneerselvam.

379.title: 4 Delhi women arrested with 6.5 kg cannabis; search on to nab supplier
379.article_body: Delhi Police's Anti-Narcotics Cell arrested four women drug peddlers near Najafgarh's Anaj Mandi and recovered 6.5 kg cannabis from their possession during a raid, an official said on Wednesday. Based on a tip-off that women sell drugs at Indira market, a trap was laid to arrest them. According to police, search is on to arrest the main supplier of drugs.

380.title: A company has asked me to donate sperm to create more Elon Musks: Musk's father
380.article_body: Elon Musk's father Errol has claimed he has been asked by a company in Colombia "to donate sperm to impregnate women and create a new generation of Elon Musks". "They haven't offered me any money but they have offered me first-class travel and five-star hotel accommodation and all that sort of stuff," the 76-year-old told The Sun.

381.title: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri booked for allegedly abusing T'gana CM
381.article_body: BJP MP Arvind Dharmapuri was booked on Wednesday for allegedly abusing Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao. Arvind, who made the alleged comments at an event in Hyderabad last week, was accused of degrading the CM's image and inciting hate towards the state government in the FIR. Notably, Arvind recently alleged that his convoy was attacked by TRS workers.

382.title: NCP workers float paper boats in potholes at Pune's Swargate junction
382.article_body: NCP workers floated paper boats in potholes at the Swargate junction in Pune to mark a protest on Wednesday. This comes a day after the Pune Municipal Corporation said that 90% of potholes on city roads had been repaired from July 15 to 18. The party workers said BJP was responsible for the bad state of the roads.

383.title: 2 gangsters involved in Sidhu Moosewala's murder case killed in encounter
383.article_body: Two gangsters involved in singer Sidhu Moosewala's murder case, namely Jagroop Singh Roopa and Manpreet Singh, were killed in a shootout with the police in Amritsar today, said Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav. He confirmed that three policemen also suffered minor injuries. "We have recovered an AK47 and a pistol," Punjab DGP further stated.

384.title: Barca only club to have no money but buy every player: Bayern's Nagelsmann
384.article_body: Following Bayern Munich striker Robert Lewandowski's transfer to Barcelona, Bayern Munich manager Julian Nagelsmann said, "Barcelona [are] the only club that [have] no money but then...[buy] every player they want." "I do not know how [they do it]. It is kind of weird...crazy," added Nagelsmann. Barcelona President Joan Laporta Estruch had recently said the club is in the "ICU" financially.

385.title: Pak record highest successful run chase at Galle Stadium in Test win vs SL
385.article_body: Pakistan recorded the highest successful run chase in Test cricket at the Galle International Stadium as they defeated Sri Lanka by four wickets. Pakistan chased down a target of 342 runs to win the match and take a 1-0 lead in the two-Test series. The previous highest successful fourth-innings chase was 268 by Sri Lanka versus New Zealand in 2019.

386.title: 58% of total work of Mumbai Coastal Road Project completed: BMC
386.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday confirmed that 58% of the total work of the Mumbai Coastal Road Project (South) has been completed. The reclamation of 107 hectares out of the total 111 hectares that constitute 97% of the project has been completed. Moreover, 70% of work on the sea wall has also been finished.

387.title: Homes, hospital evacuated as wildfire rages near Athens
387.article_body: Hundreds of people were evacuated from their homes as firefighters on Wednesday battled a wildfire that raged for a second day in the mountains near Athens. The wildfire also prompted authorities to evacuate a hospital. About 485 firefighters and 120 fire engines have been deployed to contain the blaze, which has destroyed a number of homes and businesses.

388.title: Could not find spark with the ball: Buttler on defeat against SA
388.article_body: England captain Jos Buttler said they couldn't find the spark with the ball in their defeat against South Africa on Tuesday. "It was a fantastic partnership between Rassie van der Dussen and Aiden Markram and we were not able to break that," he stated. South Africa posted 333/5 and then bundled out England for 271 to win the first ODI.

389.title: Hardik got a good shock when he was out of team for 1-2 yrs: Akhtar
389.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said Hardik Pandya got a "good shock" when he was out of the team for one-two years as he was unfit and casual. "He's become serious about his fitness," added Akhtar. Talking about Rishabh Pant, Akhtar stated, "My advice...would be to improve his physique...He is a little overweight." "He's good-looking...[and] can emerge as a model, earn in crores."

390.title: World chess champion Magnus Carlsen to give up his title
390.article_body: World number one chess player Magnus Carlsen, who's the defending world chess champion, said that he'll not defend his world championship title in 2023. "I am not motivated to play another match. I simply feel that I don't have a lot to gain," he said. "It didn't mean anything to me," he added, talking about defending the title in 2021.

391.title: Resigning only way when not respected: Akhilesh on UP minister's resignation
391.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav shared his take on the resignation of BJP MLA Dinesh Khatik, who alleged that the Yogi government sidelined him as he is a Dalit. "Where you are not respected as a minister but insulted because you're a Dalit, resigning from such a discriminatory BJP government is the only way," he tweeted in Hindi.

392.title: Putin's Iran trip shows how isolated Russia has become: US
392.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's trip to Iran shows how Russia has become isolated amid the Ukraine war, US National Security Council spokesman John Kirby said. Putin arrived in Tehran on Tuesday and held talks with Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and President Ebrahim Raisi. This is Putin's second trip abroad since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

393.title: Vikram Bhatt's romance with Sushmita started during 'Dastak' making in Seychelles: Mahesh
393.article_body: Mahesh Bhatt, coming out in support of Sushmita Sen who recently announced she's dating Lalit Modi, also shared how she met her former partner Vikram Bhatt. "During the making of 'Dastak', Vikram's romance with Sushmita started in Seychelles," he stated. "Vikram was my right hand...doing most of my work. So, he used to interact with her more vigorously," Bhatt added.

394.title: Windshield of Go First's Delhi-Guwahati flight cracks mid-air, flight diverted to Jaipur
394.article_body: The windshield of Go First's Delhi-Guwahati flight cracked mid-air after which the flight was diverted to Jaipur due to bad weather in Delhi, Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) officials said. This is the third incident of technical malfunction on a Go First aircraft in two days. On Tuesday, Go First's Mumbai-Leh and Srinagar-Delhi flights faced engine snags.

395.title: Bihar Cabinet approves lease exemption of up to 80% on govt land
395.article_body: Nitish Kumar-led Bihar Cabinet on Tuesday announced an exemption of up to 80% on land leases under the Bihar Industrial Area Development Authority (BIADA). It approved the decision for 54 units under BIADA. The rate of BIADA units has been decreased by 80% for 15 units, 60% and 40% for 12 units each and 20% for 15 units.

396.title: Maha man sets himself, wife & son on fire; he dies, other 2 survive
396.article_body: A 58-year-old man died after he set himself, his wife and son on fire while all three of them were in a car in Nagpur on Tuesday, police said. A suicide note recovered from the man's house said he was ending his life due to financial crisis, police added. The man's 55-year-old wife and 30-year-old son sustained serious burn injuries.

397.title: Gr Noida development body to sterilise street dogs free of charge
397.article_body: Greater Noida Industrial Development Authority (GNIDA) will sterilise all street dogs in its jurisdiction, which aren't covered by resident welfare associations, for free, officials said. "GNIDA will [also] bear...cost of...rabies vaccination for street dogs," a senior official from the development body said. Additionally, GNIDA will set up animal hospital and shelter for dogs and other animals.

398.title: Policeman tries to stop truck in Gujarat, it mows him down
398.article_body: A truck mowed down a policeman in Gujarat's Borsad on Wednesday at 1 am. Constable Kiran Raj was trying to stop the "suspicious" truck from Rajasthan when it ran over him, ANI reported. Raj died during treatment in hospital. This is the third incident in India in 24 hours in which a police officer was run over by a truck.

399.title: Ukraine did not fulfil terms of preliminary peace deal: Putin
399.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday said that Ukraine had not fulfilled the terms of what he described as a preliminary peace deal agreed with the Ukrainian government in March. However, Putin did not elaborate on his claim. Notably, there was no immediate response from the Ukrainian government to the Russian President's remarks.

400.title: FM will reply to Opposition's questions once she recovers from COVID: BJP's Joshi
400.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said that the central government is ready for discussion on inflation in Parliament. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is down with COVID and she will reply to questions once she recovers and when Business Advisory Committee decides and both chairs give permission. His statements come after Congress claimed that government is not allowing discussion on GST rates.

401.title: Is it unparliamentary to discuss inflation?: Priyanka Gandhi to PM Modi
401.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Wednesday alleged that PM Narendra Modi is increasing household expenditure while shying away from discussion on it in Parliament. "Is it 'unparliamentary' to discuss inflation?" she tweeted. Priyanka said that the government has increased the burden of inflation by imposing "Grihasthi Satyanash Tax (GST)" (household destruction tax) on grains, jaggery and curd.

402.title: DDA must register real estate projects with us: Delhi-RERA Chairman
402.article_body: Delhi Development Authority (DDA) must register its real-estate projects with the regulator to protect the interest of property buyers, said Delhi-Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA) Chairman Anand Kumar. Delhi-RERA has the power to take action against organisations that fail to register projects with them, he said. "If DDA delays [its] project...who is going to suffer? The buyer," he added.

403.title: 37-yr-old man held for cheating people with fake job offers in Mumbai
403.article_body: A 37-year-old man, Sandeep Raut, was arrested for cheating several people in Mumbai by promising jobs at companies like ONGC, RBI and other institutions. Police said the accused has over 18 cases registered against him across Maharashtra. Mumbai Police raided the guest house where he was staying and seized 12 ID cards, five appointment letters, rubber stamps and notary papers.

404.title: 30-yr-old woman kills self by jumping into Hussain Sagar lake in Hyd
404.article_body: A 30-year-old woman, identified as Sailaja, allegedly died by suicide after jumping into Hussain Sagar lake in Hyderabad on Wednesday morning. According to the police, the woman jumped into the lake from the NTR Garden side and locals who noticed this, informed the police. The woman's body was shifted to Gandhi Hospital mortuary and a case has been registered.
